Title: Fantastic hotel at a great price.

Positive_reviews: The staff memeber whom we checked in with whose name was Khaldoon was brilliant. So helpful, friendly and informative. The room which had been upgraded for us by the hotel was exceptional. We stayed in a one bedroom king suite with the view of the Big Ben, River Thames and London Eye. The view was so beautiful at night. Opted in for a few upgrades as it was my partners birthday so went for prosecco on arrival, and the 'celebration package' which included more prosecco in an ice bucket, balloons which were blown up around lounge area and a hand-made cake. Breakfast each morning was hosted in the hotel restaurant and was a english breakfast buffet-style. The location was so convenient and close to the main attractions such as the Sea Life Centre, London Eye, Big Ben, Houses of Parliament, etc. and not far from the Shard and bars we visited.
Title: Excellent, enjoyable stay. Worth the money for the occasion.

Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews:
Good location 
Good view
Great staff
Impressive reception area and security 
Toiletries were very good quality.
Negative_reviews:
The bathroom was not very clean, I had to clean the bath before I used it as it was full of hair and the floor and toilet lid was dirty.
The cooked breakfast was appalling, for the price you pay we should have had Good quality Food. The cold buffet was fine.
Title: We liked the hotel as it was quiet and in a good location but the food and cleanliness let it down.

Positive_reviews: Because of the Covid 19 unfortunately  we were unable to stay at our original  hotel ,The Park Pkaza River bank as it is not open to guests at the present time so we were moved to Park Pkaza Westminster ,we were also given 20% off food and drinks by the hotel . So this review is for the Park Plaza Westminster . We were not disappointed, we were given a suite with stunning views of the River Thames and the Houses of Parliament and Big Ben . The facilities in the room could not be faulted, it was roomy ,clean and well equipped and although  at the present time the cleaning staff  only  clean every third  day we were left a collection of new toiletries ,drinks each day . The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful and made our stay very relaxed . Hotel was local to everything which meant we could walk to were we wanted to visit as didnt want to have to use the Tube in current  climate .
Negative_reviews: The only two issues we had were firstly with our breakfast ,there was a great choice however because we had to have all our food served to us buffet style we found the hot prepared food was quite cold and you had to wait for certain items ,eg toast . The second issue was that on our second night ,one of our party had an issue with noisy guest and had to make three calls to reception before being resolved .

The location was fantastic for the price we paid. It's a ten minute walk from the London eye down the river and there is a small shop right next door that sold food and drinks. We went for a few drinks in the bar, views were lovely and cocktails were about £15 each. Live singers were on and atmosphere was great.

Title: Wonderful

Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews:
Great location, amazing hotel, clean modern, spacious room, would recommend the river view. You can sit in your room and while away time watching the boats and the London Eye. The bar and executive breakfast lounge has views over the river too. Vauxhall is nearest underground station and is only a few mins walk away - you are in central London in no time. 
Rooms have electric curtains and touch controls for lighting and heating. Coffee maker, tea and hot chocolate and biscuits in the room. Bath and large wet room shower in the room. 
Staff were courteous, polite and helpful. Absolutely great value for money, rooms were quiet, spacious, comfortable and clean - would definitely stay again and will be recommending to family and friends.
Negative_reviews: Nothing not to like.

Title: Very Good

Positive_reviews:
The property is located on the London embankment. This means that one can walk to the Houses of Parliament, the London Eye and a host of restaurants in less than 10 minutes. It is also has a selection of tube and bus services nearby if you don’t want to drive. The suite we stayed in was very comfortable and well equipped. We had a riverside view, which was fantastic, (you can request this). The alternative is a train track or other buildings! 
Overall the staff were the absolute best feature of the hotel - genuinely helpful, funny and attentive.
Negative_reviews:
There were a few issues with dirty sheets being left in the sofa bed - this was quickly rectified. 
The main observation is that the hotel is pretty, but not entirely practical. For example, the pool is great for lap swimming; but there’s only one private shower in the changing room. A major concern was that when the door to the female changing room is open, you can see into actual changing ares from the corridor - not good especially if someone is in a state of undress at the time!

Positive_reviews: Lovely hotel, great location
Negative_reviews: Impossible to get hold of the reception staff from the room. Spent most of the morning trying to get service, room service was poor, items missed off breakfast, luke warm water instead of tea. Then having tried all morning to get hold of reception once we were finally relaxing we were disturbed by staff knocking on the door and phoning the room which ruined our celebration. Excellent facilities & location but very poor service which ruined the relaxing celebration we’d planned.
Title: Good

Negative_reviews:
The male bar staff made us feel we were at Faulty Towers. They were surly and unhelpful, the antithesis of the female staff. The male staff behaved in a way which suggested they didn’t like their jobs and disliked any interaction with the public. 
Myself and two others who I didn’t know were left naked for almost 30 minutes in the spa area when our lockers refused to open and as the pool attendant was nowhere to be seen, had to make repeated calls to the duty manager to get someone to come and open the lockers.
Title: Excellent

Positive_reviews: Staff were amazing - friendly and helpful. Room was comfortable. Breakfast was lovely and the upgrade to the executive lounge for breakfast was much appreciated. Amazing views. Bar was pleasant too.
Negative_reviews: More seating in the bar area would have been good - we couldn't find anywhere to sit on either Friday or Saturday night. When we sat at a table, we were told that it was only for food and the restaurant had closed. We tried to explain that there was nowhere to sit, but kept being told to 'sit on one of the lower tables', which were all full. Room - which was comfortable - was not really cleaned after first night (insufficient loo roll, dirty mugs left behind) and the sofa bed was made up as if we were expecting more guests. I appreciate the latter is an error, and we lived with that, but I would have liked to have had the room cleaned/tidied a little.

When my daughter removed the "cork"(?) to get the water out of the tub, a lot of water flooded out on the bathroom floor from underneath the tub. It was reported at the front desk the day after.

Title: Good

Room_info: One-Bedroom Suite with Balcony and River View
Positive_reviews: There’s not one thing I didn’t like about the property, only the fact I couldn’t afford to stay there longer! The staff were so accommodating and attentive. As a long shot, I put in a special request due to it being an anniversary and birthday trip, expecting nothing as it didn’t come at a cost, but when we arrived to our room they’d decorated it with balloons and petals and we got a free bottle of wine! The view from the balcony was fantastic and I couldn’t be more grateful to the staff for going out of their way. When it was our tome to check out, we were able to put our bags away so we could come back after wondering around later to get them to go home. I honestly couldn’t fault it!

Title: Awesome hotel

Positive_reviews: The view is amazing and the hotel staff were very nice. The room was nicely laid out and breakfast was quite good. We enjoyed the pool and sauna as well.
Negative_reviews: The bed squeaked every time you moved. The air conditioning didn't really work and we were far too warm the whole time. Breakfast was nice but the coffee machine seems unnecessary and the queues were always quite long. Some of the chairs/tables were very low and the legs stuck out. Since there was so much queueing behind me about four people tripped over or kicked the leg of my chair. The lift to the 14th floor was used by every floor in the hotel it seemed which meant that we waited for a few minutes every time.

Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: Very nice clean Hotel was my second stay. Staff very polite
Negative_reviews: Because I had stayed before it was my wife’s birthday so arrange a treat for all the family so booked 3 rooms a family room for my son and his 2 children. I pre arrange a cot before arrival. But when he arrived to his room there was no cot or any bed made up for his daughter. They also discovered the main bed was broken. Reported this to reception who said they would deal with this and visited the room and said the bed could not be fixed. They changed the room and promised a cot as we had dinner arrangements. When we arrived back to the Hotel around 7.30 as my grandson is only 1 they went back to the room to find there was no cot? My son came back to reception to repot this again they said they would get this sorted. After 20 minutes still no cot had arrived. So I asked at reception as it was past my grandsons bed time. They said they wound speak with housekeeping. I did comment that this was the third time we had asked about a cot also it had been pre arranged. They said they would get straight onto it. It took in all over a hour which I found was unacceptable and spoilt the weekend and the surprise birthday with no apologies.

Negative_reviews: We were ignored at the bar for 15 minutes between 10:35-10:50pm. At which point we gave up the idea of ordering a drink and went back to room instead. Thought this was rather rude to be honest.

Title: Good

Positive_reviews:
The property was great. However when we arrived at 3 pm the room was still not ready, check I. Is at 2pm. We waited over an hour to check in, then was told a supervisor needed to check our room. When they finally gave us the key we were told “ sorry for your wait, we are really busy. We ve given you a room upgrade” this was a lie as we had booked the room which we were given.
The facilities were great. However they do not mention that if you want to use the pool you have to book a time slot, this very nearly caused a melt down for my Autistic Daughter. Thankfully they let us in. If you need to book, tell us!!
Finally we found the pillows hard and uncomfortable, we left with stiff necks. Not really what I would expect for £244 per night. Lovely hotel, great location, great views, disappointing service and comfort.

Title: As I was celebrating my birthday the hotel was the perfect gift me. The river view was amazing.

Positive_reviews: Location is excellent as a bridge between central London and the South, close to Vauxhall station. Room was large, very clean, and with a very comfortable bed. Bathroom was spotless also. The room was very quiet and we slept very well. Staff was kind and helpful.
Negative_reviews: While staff was kind and helpful, service in general was not as good as we would have expected given the rating and cost of the hotel. There was complimentary tea in the room, but no coffee. We needed to have an early dinner before going out to a show, but the restaurant apparently didn't open until late. Someone woke us up by knocking to clean our room at 9 AM, something I have never seen at any hotel, especially on check-out date - far too early to come by.

Negative_reviews:
We were offered an upgrade to a suite for an additional £30 which we declined. We had booked an executive double. This room had one small windowed floor level giving no view so quite claustrophobic. We then accepted the upgrade. The suite was of a good size although the view was poor ( over the railway lines ).
We have stayed at this hotel before and had a view over the river. Clearly we didn’t book the correct sort of room this time but I’m surprised that the suites are not better placed.

Title: Overall it was such a nice and joyful stay

Positive_reviews: Modern decor in the Executive Room was lovely.  It was well-appointed with all I could need/.want for my trip.  Fine views from the room.  Gym was enough to maintain fitness away from home during a short stay.  Location was excellent.  By far and away, the best thing about Park Plaza is the staff.  Travelled with my elderly mother and the staff took exceptional care of her.  Special mention to Ken who looked after us at breakfast and even looked out for us on the second morning so that he could give my mum the lovely table by the window in his section. That man should get some kind of hospitality award - a consummate professional and just a genuinely nice guy who made my mum feel special.  Also Abdullah - he asked us if we needed a late checkout and arranged the extra hour we asked for whilst we ate breakfast.  Superb care and attention that made my mum's stay very special.

There's a lot of fancy lights and suchlike but it's all handled tastefully and looks classy instead of being garish like many other places.

It kind of defeats the purpose of the note and is very wasteful to replace towels everyday considering the huge amounts of resources hotels use.

Title: Wonderful

The staff was ever so helpful and kind, always smiling too. 
Arrival, early check in- no problem.
Had a horrible headache on the 1st evening sent me the right directìon - to the embankment groceries.
Asked what can i do with luggages after checking out, while my daughter and I went to explore the city...concierge kept them safe.
Outside concierge ( Krisztián Budai and Sabi) also got talking to us and gave suggestion + guide + marked map where to go with my 6 yrs old. 
Waiting staff also kind.
Seem to have the right people there who are always smiling, happy to help. 
Thank you for our wonderful stay. We will be back!

Title: Good alternative😀

Positive_reviews: Door staff and concierge very friendly and welcoming.
Negative_reviews: Upon checking in €118 was taken from the account and we did not realise, then when we asked about it they told us that it was a £100 deposit for 2 nights which we should have been told when checking in and that if we didn’t have anything from the mini bar/movies etc it would be returned as soon as we checked out. We checked out at 11am and at 5.30pm when we returned to collect our bags it still had not been put back in the account. When we mentioned this to them they said they did not know if the room was clean or not but they have 6 hours to do so. When we got the all clear for the room they still told us that it would take 2/3 working days to go back on the account as it was a debit card. Very disappointing as there was no offer for our loss of money from spending on the holiday.

Title: Great stay highly recommend and will return on next visit to London

Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: Location, Comfortable river view room, Room Service and it's very helpful staff.
Negative_reviews:
Park Plaza is a very comfortable and well located hotel to stay in.This was my 4th stay. Their room service staff is polite, professional and very efficient BUT, the Housekeeping Department is not at all at par with the rest of the hotel. I had to ask the people concerned in the lobby EVERYDAY to make sure my room was cleaned as it wasn't done on the 2nd day. Moreover even though I requested a change of sheets on my 4th day, all they did was change 2 of the pillow covers and duvet cover. The bed sheet, which needs to be changed more often was not!!
I stayed there for 6 days but my bedsheet wasn't changed! Even after speaking to people at the desk.
It was futile calling housekeeping and get into an arguement with someone there (and I spoke to them quite a few times to ask again and again for face towels and for laundry etc), as almost everyone I spoke to in Housekeeping didn't seem to understand English or in fact even spoke it clearly. Park Plaza really needs to improve their Housekeeping services.

Title: Wonderful

Positive_reviews: The hotel I book every year met all my expectations and keeps offering a fantastic price-performance ratio. I was slightly disappointed with my room at first (compared to what I've been used to from this hotel and room category in previous stays), but was able to change the room immediately thanks to the very friendly reception staff.
Negative_reviews: I've missed Paul, one of London's most sympathetic and charming doormen, who apparently has left the hotel and he left big footprints that his successors have not yet filled. Also, there were unusually many children in the house, who ran around in the corridors and the lobby from time to time or made some noise, but I am used to this hotel in a different way and therefore I consider it as an exception. All in all, I have no real reason to complain.
Title: Fantastic city hotel with extraordinary price-performance-ratio

Nonetheless I must point out a very nice and professional member of the staff that helped us beyond his duty and made us feel very welcomed, Mr Khaloout. Thank you for making our stay so comfortable and nice. :)

Title: Lovely stay

Positive_reviews:
Super comfy bed. Very clean, and staff were helpful upon arrival. Loads of tea and coffee provided. 
Big bathroom. Lovely big TV.
Negative_reviews:
Breakfast was £12.50 each which I think is a bit much so me and my partner went to the convince store next door and got some fresh pastry’s for £2 total! The ‘air conditioning’ was not cold whatsoever. It was on 16° and we was sweating all night as the vent was blowing out hot air. 
I also don’t like how there was only a small bottle of water that was complimentary as it didn’t last and had to fill the kettle with the water in the bathroom!
The shower was confusing to work as well.

Shame about the grumpy female staff on the front desk of the bar/restaurant who was less than helpful on Friday evening. We had asked for a table and were told to sit anywhere, when we did sit at a table and asked for a menu for food once we'd got drinks with our kids, she got really upset with us, made us get off the table and waved us to the bar area, no other tables available so we went back and asked her to show us to where she meant, and she was less than happy to help show us by walking with us , then shoved 2 tables together, she was really annoyed, as though we were asking just too much, rude!!!

Negative_reviews:
Room cleaning is very bad, used and empty soap bottels are left in the bathroom, the staff did not clean the room floor eventhough it was clearly dirty, the furniture in the room were so dusty, in our second night the phone in our room rang at 3:00 am and hung up a few seconds later, it woked us up for at least an hour, on our last night, the room fire alarm sounded at 7:30 am as we were asleep and everything was fine, it creeped the hell out of us and my bregnant wife was terrafyed by its loudness.
Last but not least, the tables in the resturants were always felthy and had a bad smell, that was clear to me after I saw how the staff cleans it, a resturant staff member took a dry napcin, spreaded some water on it and draged it on the table with the food leftovers just once and that was it, there were food ubder a few tables that just stood there all the time, that was really bad.

Title: We had a fantastic stay

Positive_reviews: Central location, outstanding views from room. Good breakfast selection. Mark has exceptional customer service skills. Lovely Elemis toiletries.
Negative_reviews:
We should have been able to book into our two rooms from 2pm. This was an 80th birthday present for my Dad. We arrived at 3.30pm to a long queue and were then causally informed the room with a river view wouldn’t be ready for a ‘long time’ due to previous guests leaving late. We were told to come back in an hour which is completely unacceptable. Came back after about 40 mins and complained to another receptionist who unfortunately didn’t appear to have a full grasp of English - we seemed to be at cross purposes. I emphasised that there wasn’t going to be a lot of point in booking a room with a view if it was dark by the time we got it, but she just kept reassuring me we would get a room with a view! I offered to clean the room myself as I really wanted my Dad to see the view in daylight. Eventually Mark came to the rescue. He took charge of the situation, and discovered the room we were supposed to have hadn’t even begun to be cleaned. He then moved heaven and earth to get us transferred to the sister half of the hotel and upgraded us to a much better suite and view of the river with the Houses of Parliament. He definitely saved the day and for us the reputation of the hotel. But it had taken an hour and 40 minutes for us to get my Dad into his room, so we weren’t able to fit in a pre-theatre meal.
The only other downsides were no one answered the phone when I had a query late at night - and the next morning the phone kept ringing but there was no one there when I answered it. You have to get all the information about breakfast times/location and the pool from the TV channel - a paper guide would be good, especially for older guests. Breakfast was great for us but by the time we left at 9.10am there was a massive queue - so best to go early.
Title: Poor first impressions but improved

Positive_reviews: We had a lovely time and all of the staff were exceptional!! They couldn’t do enough and were such a happy team.  Well done everyone.

Cooked breakfast is not great, it's a buffet and most things have dried out, gone hard or cold.

Negative_reviews:
We didn’t have our room made up for twin bed which I’d booked & sent email to ensure that had twin bed. Got an upgrade but think that was cos no twin. Went to room & it was a double, so housekeeping were to make into twin while we were kindly given voucher to have free drink in bar. Told would take 10mn so waited an hour. It had not been done. So had to go back to reception from 15th floor & they got house keeping onto it. So we were then in the room & had already shifted table & chairs to make room for twin bed to be shifted to the right. There was only one packet of biscuits in the room & one bottle of water for 2 people. So I asked for 3 bottles & 3 biscuits to make up for lack of these & for inconvenience that bed still not done after an hour! Also told the view we had in the upgrade was lovely but it was of the hotel opposite, you could nearly see into the room. The view doesn’t bother me, except when someone tells you that you have a city view & you can’t see the city unless you went to the very edge of the window on right & leaned. 
Lovely hotel & would defo stay again when I London next.

Negative_reviews:
Unfortunately, it either lacks staff, management skills or both. 
In the sauna they boast cold or room temperature drinking water - there was no cold water. The towels ran out in the morning. 
Room service: it took over 2 hours for my meal to arrive - despite numerous phone calls. 
When we arrived, there was only one robe in the room and the bathroom floor was dirty - which means the room was not checked prior to occupancy.

Title: Great City, great hotel, great location.

Noted it was my partner's birthday and received complimentary drinks. Comfy bed and fancy remote control lighting and windows/curtains. Great location and everything was clean and tidy. Lovely if you're enjoying the South Bank.
Negative_reviews: The restaurant is a bit too small so there was a queue of around 10-15 mins to get in at 9am for breakfast. The main shower was leaking and so poorly pressurised as to be rendered useless. Also, despite the bathroom having the usual complimentary shower gel, there was no hand soap, which was a bit odd.

Title: Short stay

Positive_reviews:
I have stayed here a few times and this was by far the best stay yet!...  Okay to be fair we got a complementary upgrade to Plaza On The River due to a few problems with our last stay at the Park Plaza Riverbank. 
So Plaza On River is another hotel within the same building of the Park Plaza Riverbank and shares most of the same facilities.  The rooms however are more classic with a warmer feeling to them and they obviously focus on BEAUTIFUL river views. 
We had also been granted executive access with complementary food and drink (including alcohol from 6pm-8pm), a lovely peaceful lounge bar with stunning views of Houses Of Parliament, London Eye and many more landmarks. 
All in all we had a fantastic stay and nothing was too much trouble from the lovely reception team and the staff in the Executive Lounge.
Negative_reviews: Nothing on this trip.
Title: Great stay!...  We will be back!

Positive_reviews: Location is perfect, walking distance to London Eye and Big Ben. 8 mins walk to subway station. Very convenient location. Room is clean, staff are nice. Breakfast is very good and tasty.

The hotel is big, restaurant is rather small, so breakfast always need to queue for wait. Swimming pool need to book time slot in advance or it will be book out very soon.

Was a shame as staff were great and the actual hotel has huge potential but unfortunately no where near the standard it claims to be due mainly to poor housekeeping. Also no parking available on site but they do offer a valet service at a cost of £45 for 24 hours, unsure if they said they had parking online or not could have been a mistake on my part but not the end of the world. Was just mainly disappointed with the lack of cleanliness in the room, didn’t really look like the room had been made ready prior to us checking in as the bath was absolutely filthy, most of which came off simply by me running the shower over it, which shows no one had even attempted to clean it.

The staff is very well organised, especially at breakfast (when we were there it was very busy but they always found a table for us and the waiting time was minimal). We also liked the fact you need to book your time for the pool - so it’s never overcrowded.
Negative_reviews: It’s a bit of a walk to the closest metro (about 10 minutes) and there’s not much else in the immediate vicinity except a grocery store. But it is at the same time just a short walk on the shore to some major kids’ attractions (Shrek, London Eye, Aquarium, London Dungeon) and Westminster.

Negative_reviews:
Booking reported the garage; there is no garage but valet parking. It means, £45 and let someone else park your car. In an area like that, it is a very bad lack by Booking.com. I was forced to look for alternative at the very last moment.
The room was ridiculously cold. There was only the possibility to switch on air conditioning. When I asked for clarification to the reception, I was told they could have provided a heater for me. The choice was between the noise of a heater or the silent cold. I do not understand how a four stars hotel has not a heating system available at any time to the guest.
The view from the room was the railway. The room was not supposed to have the view on the river, but what I found was quite poor.

Positive_reviews: This hotel was chosen for it's location being on the riverbank and not too far from Waterloo Station. Also the price including breakfast was reasonable for a 4* hotel in London.

Service in the bar/restaurant, we ordered a toasted sandwich which took nearly an hour to arrive!! Breakfast, tables not laid up correctly, items not replenished as soon as they ran out, having to keep asking for things more than once. I would have expected better from a 4* hotel :-( !

Positive_reviews: The hotel itself is lovely and the reception staff was very helpful and the evening meal at the hotel was excellent food and service was great. It just a shame that the same restaurant was so disappointing the next morning.
Negative_reviews: The issues at breakfast was ridiculous and would probably stop me from going again due to the lack of organisation from the staff and the manager stating "we have had worse issues than this". When you return to your table you don't expect people to be sat there and us having to move to another table      and being forgotten about with food on the table but no cutlery and drinks. The table next to us got up to get food and one of the staff removed a chair to take it to another table. Needless to say the couple wasn't happy and had to get a chair themselves from another table. As this was a treat to take my wife for her 40th birthday to london for the first time and see a show didn't quite end the way I would have liked.

Title: Riverside luxury

Room_info: Deluxe King Room with River View
Positive_reviews:
Location was great and facilities were excellent. The rooms were well presented and comfortable with some great modern touches.
Our room had fantastic views of the Thames and local tourist attractions.
Tea and coffee facilities were excellent as were the availability of iron/ironing board and in room entertainment
The breakfast selection was excellent and good quality.
Negative_reviews:
Signage around the reception area could be improved as there was no obvious sign for check-in and check-out and there was always a que of people waiting to sign -in with no members of staff available at check-out.
The room was NOT available on our arrival and had to wait approx. 2 hrs, although we were offered a complimentary drink at the bar while we waited.
We asked to extend our check out time to make our homeward journey arrangements easier and although this was catered for we were only given 1 hour complimentary and had to pay for a further 1 hour ourselves, considering our room was delayed on arrival I feel this could have been waivered.
The staff at the bar/dining room could give better communication as to the protocol to follow while in the dining room and bar seating area.
Overall communication was poor, We had to ask questions rather than being explained to by staff on our arrival of certain aspects of the hotel.
Title: A fantastic overall experience,but improvements could be made.

Positive_reviews: Location,  restaurant and rooms.
Negative_reviews: The lighting...
Title: Good

Positive_reviews: The little treats left in the room and the free upgrade as it was my wife's birthday.
Negative_reviews: Information at front desk from a white male member of staff. I asked on arrival at 12.10 approximately, if l could pre book a cab for the evening as we were going to see a show in the west end for my wife's birthday. I was informed that it would not be necessary as there are always plenty of cabs outside and it would not really be necessary to book. When we went down in the evening to get a cab at 18.55, there were no cabs, and a queue ! I complained to staff who went out into the street and eventually hailed a cab. We arrived 20 minutes late for the show which spoiled the evening. Can this be sent onto management for there review. The date was 13/10/19 at 18.55

The safe box didn’t work either. When I entered this room, the room welcomed me with a chestnut lying on the aisle, which led me to questions on whether the room service did their jobs before my arrival. I don’t know what happened upstairs, but hitting noise was often heard during my stay. 
The room number is 130.  Everyone is strongly recommended to avoid this room.

Negative_reviews: Not all rooms as good as others of same grade (we had two the same and felt one was a clear step up from the other - pending upgrade?). We were told both mornings breakfast wasn't included for some guests which wasn't correct. To be fair we were told not to worry and it was sorted but disappointing that notes weren't updated for the second day. Bar pricey (though maybe not surprising for central London). Some public areas showing wear and tear. Phone in room not working when we had to call reception at 12.30am to report very noisy neighbours.
Title: Good but not great

Room_info: Studio Double Room with Sofa Bed
Positive_reviews: It was lovely and modern, the location was perfect. Staff were friendly and mostly helpful.
Negative_reviews: When we were arrived I was told our room was ready but the receptionist wanted to check our room so to take a seat for 5mins. 20 mins later I went back to reception, our room was ready. I was told there was a sofabed in there but someone would come up shortly to make it. When we got to our room there was no sofabed. We called the guest services who were unsure of what we wanted. I went down from the 16th floor and spoke to reception. She questioned ms at first as she really thought there was a sofabed in our room. She asked if we had pland and yes we did, it was my birthday. She said to get ready in the room we were in and she would sort another room. Concierge would move our bags later. Before we left the room was ready. When we returned back to the hotel that evening with two very tried children, the sofa bed wasn't even made. We had to call guest servives/reception again to ask someone to do it. In the morning my husband tried to have a shower which nearly flooded the bathroom as the shower tray was blocked.

Title: Cracking Hotel

Positive_reviews: Everything else.  Position of hotel, bedrooms and inparticular wardrobe storage and bathroom was excellent as was cleanliness within bedroom.  Highly recommended and I would still return again.
Negative_reviews: Hotel and facilities were very good.  Attention to detail with regard cleanliness of tables and inparticular flooring around the restaurant seating at breakfast sadly lacking but otherwise very good - I am quite particular.  It really annoys me when there are sugar packets and crumbs on the floor around the table you are being taken to sit at and when tea and coffee is poured but no teaspoons are provided in your initial table lay, so you have to ask for these and the staff have to source these when they should be available and on the table in the first place or automatically provided when your drinks are brought.  We spent 7 nights here and these issues were daily, with no exception.   Standards slipped sadly since our last visit two years ago, but that said I would still return again.  This is still one of the best hotels I have stayed.

Title: Great deal for this excellent hotel.

Positive_reviews:
Fab location, away from the masses but walking distance to Westminster. We actually walked to Covent Garden from the hotel. Even though we didn’t pay for a river view we had one. 
Love the big feel of the hotel. Rare in London. Very comfy bed. 
We love the hotel and will definitely return.
Negative_reviews:
Sadly the room had not been cleaned to the expected standard. Clearly not hoovered. A stray human hair on the sheets when we hadn’t yet slept on the bed. 
Mark the guest relations manager was superb. Offered a change of room. Changed the linen and cleaned room. Plus refunded 25% in apology. A pleasure to deal with.

Apart from the hair we gave reception a written list with the issues but nothing was done in our 5 days stay. We tried to talk to the housekeeping lady on our floor but even as she was very friendly, she wasn't very good at english.

Thank you for making my stay very comfortable as usual.

Went down and asked again and were given a suite on a higher floor - much better.  Would have appreciated more comfortable chairs so we could relax and enjoy the view.
Neither of the TVs worked properly but this not too much of a problem so did not report it.
Did not take breakfast as not value for money and excellent shop next dor selling from croissants etc

The poached resembled hard boiled eggs instead.

Negative_reviews:
When I arrived our room wasn't ready
We got told 2pm check in our room was not ready til after 3.45
We had to stay in a friends room until this was sorted 
Then we got given 3 different floors
First was floor 10
Then given floor 13 which the lift only went to floor 12
Then floor 4
Then floor 9
With a double bed we paid for 2 single beds and didn't get this at all
Not happy 1 bit

Negative_reviews: Nothing
Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: Views very spectacular and service was great! Got gift valchures for the restaurant if we skipped room cleaning and that was great.
Negative_reviews: For the price we payed for the hotelroom I was the bed was more comfortable. I want a bed I don't want to get out of but this bed was rock hard and not a place you wanted to stay for more then you needed too..

Title: A happy stay

Positive_reviews: Very cosy had great time  .staff very good
Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: Good location. Comfy room. Was able to check-in early.
Negative_reviews:
Breakfast service poor. Breakfast room was full and was asked to go to a conference room restaurant (with no wondows) whereby still overcrowded and short on plates and breakfast and even had our allocated seats taken due to confusion by staff. 
The fuse in our room went twice because of a faulty hairdryer. I reported it first to cleaning staff, then reception after a 10min wait. After 15min maintenance fixed the fuse but after the second occurrence the receptionist promised a new hairdryer. No hairdryer was brought up. When leaving the hotel I tried to speak to the same receptionist but she asked me to "wait one minute" and then checked-in two seperate customers although she was fully aware of the situation. Instead of waiting further we requested a hairdryer from the concierge. After returning from our evening out there was still no replacement hairdryer. 
Furthermore after meeting the duty manager (Mr Salem) I was promised a loyalty membership would be created in my name with enough points to be able to book one night stay in any hotel own by the brand. This has not happened. The hotel service is so poor and the attitude appears to be that it doesn't matter due to the good location and high turnover of customers. Very disappointing.

I had to chase up tea bags etc, which were promptly provided. For the price I paid I would have expected my room done each day so I wasn't impressed. sorry guys!! The bathroom problem needs attention, I did mention it to concierge staff when requesting my extras.

Title: We will go back but skip the breakfast.

Positive_reviews: Great location to Vauxhall train station only a 5 minute walk. Lots of places to eat near by and westminister only a 20 minute walk away. Not as busy as most parts of London which was great. Overall great location.
Negative_reviews: There was a door in our room which was joined to the room next door. We didn't bother to open it but on the last night someone from the other side tried to open it. We were unsure if this was the cleaners or not but was a breach of privacy. We told the front desk and they sorted the issue. Paid for a room with a view but there were trees blocking them. Not their fault but really if you paying for a view you should be put high up. We didn't mind.
Title: Brilliant stay in London

Positive_reviews: Amazing hotel. The location, hotel reception and staff was brilliant. My room was fantastic; quiet, spacious, comfortable and relaxing. The bed was super comfortable. The room itself was beautiful with tea/coffee facilities.I also ordered room service in the evening, which was very prompt and the food very good. Absolutely loved this hotel, didn't want to leave. I was in London for a running event and the staff at the front desk helped me navigate the London tube system to get to my destination. It was also so close to Westminster Bridge and some key attractions like the London Eye and Big Ben, with the hop on/hop off bus stop just a 5min stroll away.  Loved it. Hope to make it back soon 😄
Negative_reviews: Nothing. All fabulous!

Title: Very enjoyable and would return.

Room_info: Studio Double Room with Sofa Bed
Positive_reviews:
Breakfast was amazing - level 12 in the executive lounge - staff were exceptional - couldn't speak higher of this part of the team. 
Facilities overall were excellent - only issue with facilities was the uncomfortable sofa bed for our 2 children (10yrs and 12yrs) we needed to ask for additional padding for the sofa to make it comfortable.
Negative_reviews: There was an issue with our booking upon arrival even though I had called from Australia prior to the holiday to confirm details - this however didn't seem to have reached/been recorded at reception with our details. We were changed to a room without a view of the river (which we had paid for) but were offered breakfast in the executive lounge for our stay. Throughout out stay however, there was numerous issues which seemed to come down to housekeeping. Hotel staff were happy to help and very polite but no followup from housekeeping was very frustrating. We had to call several times to have any issue resolved. There was a list of things but having our TV not working for the duration for movies (TV stations were working) was annoying and almost the final straw, and whilst staff tried their best to rectify, maintenance and services couldn't get it to work at all and communication between hotel staff and maintenance/outside services was very poor. Another change of room still didn't find the TV working! Concierge was brilliant, very knowledgeable and helpful and I hope the housekeeping services improve as that would have greatly improved our experience.
Title: Great facilities and location but experiencing numerous issues over our stay was disappointing.

Positive_reviews: Everything

Title: What a lovely hotel.

Positive_reviews: The room was very modern, the controls for the lights, the curtains and others were all electric and accessible from the bed, and the room/bathroom were a very good size. We paid extra for a room with a river view and it was well worth it. The Sauna/Steam room were also very good.
Negative_reviews: There was a little lack of attention to detail in the room: there was a gap between the bathroom door and the wall where you could see through to the insulation, not all the surfaces were spotlessly clean (with fingerprints on the bathroom door knobs for example) and there was no plug in the bathroom. The swimming pool was very small and crowded, and although family time was between 8am and 8pm, there were still screaming children after that time.
Title: Modern hotel close to Westminster

Positive_reviews: Great location and a very nice hotel.
Negative_reviews: Breakfast is a bun fight and food is average (no other meals taken)
Title: Exceptional

Room_info: Studio Double Room with Sofa Bed
Positive_reviews: The Location was excellent and most of the staff were very helpful. The doorman went above and beyond to be helpful and obliging and always with a happy disposition. The staff at reception were also very helpful. The cleaning staff didn’t seem to be on top of things.
Negative_reviews: Our room was a bit cramped and was not the cleanest. The fridge was very dirty and even had stale cheese at the bottom of it. The bathroom floor had hairs on it and there was an empty bottle under the sink when we arrived. They didn’t give us fresh cups and glasses every day and we had to ask for hand towels every day. They took the old ones and never replaced them.

Negative_reviews:
Please, please, get room service staff who understand English well enough to take an order correctly.  I had two nights of room service, and each time I had a staff member who didn't fully understand me ad didn't give me what I'd ordered.
Also, please pick up the phone on the front desk if we're calling down to you.  I know you get them - as I had to personally go down to front desk several times, I saw calls coming in that were not answered.

Negative_reviews:
Minor things ( but a lot of them!) you do not expect from 4* hotel:
- swimming pool is supposed to open 6:30 am, but one day it only opened 7:00 am without any reason given when I asked
- most of the time no one is attending the pool
- room is not clean (e.g. pile of dust under beds)
- only half a role of toilet paper in the room
- you cannot call housekeeping for extra toilet paper as the phone does not work
- no towels in swimming pool

Negative_reviews: Breakfast is a real mess. First line is to registration and then you move to the next line and wait to be seated. If you eat alone, it is by the bar. Big families get the best tables by the window. Modest breakfast in a too small room. A change is needed as soon as possible!
Title: Very good hotel

Room_info: Deluxe King Room with River View
Positive_reviews: Loved the whole vibe of the hotel and the rooms were great. We were on the 14th floor with a great view of Westminster etc. Great food and cocktails in the Chino restaurant for lunch. Great that there is a taxi rank right outside.
Negative_reviews: Shower pressure not great. Breakfast slightly below par. Premier Inn actually does a better breakfast! Signage around hotel is confusing and had to ask where to go all the time. Hotel still hasn’t refunded our deposit. Will be investigating this and awaiting a response from our email.

Title: Very Good

Positive_reviews: The design of the hotel was modern and stylish, and my room was very well furnished with a comfortable bed, a nice armchair and even an iron and an ironing board.  I also liked the nifty control panel with which you could open and close the curtain, activate the ”Do not disurb” sign etc.
Negative_reviews: The location is certainly good with many sights within walking distance, but the immediate surroundings are frankly not very interesting The breakfast buffet is good if you like typical English breakfasts with toast and hot food (beans, bacon and sausages etc.), but personally I think the selection of breads and vegetables could have been better. What I lacked in my room was above all a functioning minibar/refrigerator (as a matter of fact, mine was locked and could apparently not be opened for several days even though I twice brought it to the attention of the staff at the reception. For practical purposes, I also think it would be useful to have a toilet brush in the bathroom.

Room Service , Many problems throughout our stay,  Housekeeping no continuity missing things from our room.  Breakfast cards not left in room, Card payments no signal in our room so 4 visits during our breakfast from different people to try take £5 payment !!! Eventually we found cash .  Our breakfast by then was cold and ruined.  Missing Slippers & toiletries. 
4 occasions we had to call for breakfast cards. 
When in a wheelchair it’s easier to have breakfast in rooms so this is what we were doing.
Housekeeping jamming up corridor so could not get through with wheelchair. 
20 minute wait this morning for lift to get wheelchair in .. lift continually busy no room
for wheelchair.   Contact me if you’d like to discuss more issues .

Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: The location was great, we didn't eat in the hotel as breakfast was expensive and during our stay the hotel struggled to cope with the number of guests for breakfast.  The room was comfortable as was the bed.  my sister and I enjoyed our swim in the hotel pool.
Negative_reviews: Our bathrooms were not cleaned properly.  There was black mould between the tiles and on the ceiling.  We didn't like the option of going green offered at check in.   We were advised we would only have to make our own beds and in return we received a bottle of house wine which was collected at the bar but were not allowed to drink in there we had to take it to our room.  Going green actually meant our room would not be serviced at all for one day.   So we had no clean towels, change of cups, glasses and replenish of the hospitality tray.  My room was serviced the next day but my sister's room never got serviced at all.  We did complain at check out and received a voucher each for the restaurant that covered the price of a coffee each (4)  prior to our departure.

Title: Ok but not satisfied,

Positive_reviews: Hotel was very clean, rooms were clean too. Our hand held shower was squirting water out of the head, probley simple to fix prob just needed a rubber washer, could have been a 2 min job for housekeeping to do.
Negative_reviews:
Our safe was broken,
 In room 659 we had our passports and quite a bit of cash too, we spoke to the receptionist the first day about this and the second day and the third day, and nothing was done about it, I'm not sure if anyone even came to look at it, as we were not informed about it. So we left it, we had to take all our cash and passports out each day with us as we had, a busy itinary each day for the four nights we were there, , we were not happy but if you have to report a broken safe 3 times, it's not great at all.  So not a happy couple at all. Just added worry and pressure each day to our trip.

Title: Perfect location

Room_info: Studio Double Room with Sofa Bed
Positive_reviews: Excellent Stay in the hotel from 31st May to 14th June'19. Stayed with my wife and son. Excellent Hotel, excellent location, excellent staff, exceptional view of the river from the room, spectacular views of the River & London skyline from the executive lounge - everything exceeded my expectation. The staff was great - Special thanks to Salem (Manager), Khaldoon (Front Desk) and Edel (Executive Lounge) - all of whom went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. Icing on the cake was meeting the Indian and Bangladesh Cricket team members in the hotel. Will definitely come back here !!
Negative_reviews: Breakfast in Chino Latino was great. However, the menu was same everyday. Stayed in the hotel for 14 days, so the breakfast became monotonous after a few days. This can be improved by bringing some variation to the menu every day.

This makes sitting at low lounge tables or at bar chairs uncomfortable.  The mono-color decor (everything in varying shades of charcoal grey) did not show up that way on your web site.  The limited pallet made the hotel look like a cave with an occasional light.  No restaurants other than the hotel restaurant and the burger barge nearby.

Title: Absolutely amazing

Positive_reviews: Lovely hotel, really modern and bright. Nice interior design and friendly staff. We decided to go for a la carte breakfast but this was not to our liking, eggs benedict did not taste good, poached eggs were hard even after asking for runny yolk. These were replaced but still the dish was not tasty at all. Again, lovely staff were trying to help where they can. Room adapted for wheelchair use was very nice and practical, in room environmental controls high tech and helpful. Wifi signal was good and room size was adequate. No complaints overall, hotel was nicer than expected.
Negative_reviews: Nespresso machine in the room did not work, breakfast was not great.

Title: Luxurious and modern hotel offering a professional service

Positive_reviews: 99% of the staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. The spa area was excellent and the staff very capable this morning. Sauna and steam room working well and clean.swimming pool was excellent .
Negative_reviews:
At check out the receptionist was rude and insulting. She needs customer care training and should not judge people by their colour.
She happens to be black and i couldn't understand why she was so arrogant and refused to serve me and got the manager to serve me.
Till that point i had a wonderful time but she ruined my stay here and left unhappy and sad. I am a world traveller and been in all the continents in stayed 4* 5* 6* hotels due to my job as a Banker with HSBC. 
This receptionist started serving other guests and not listening to my query on the invoice.  
She has poor manners and a chip on her shoulder and arrogant and rude.
Title: Apart from the chechout incident of poor guest service excellent

The lift arrangements were a little confusing . 
The room would not have been suitable for a wheelchair had I been travelling with my sister. 
There was no space to push the twin beds apart. Comfortable beds though. 
Small bottles of water would have been appreciated.

Title: Weekend break

Positive_reviews: The room met our requirements but the hotel didn’t take into consideration the trip was for my daughter ‘s Birthday. I requested a river view. We did receive, complementary access to the Executive Lounge but would have been very disappointed if we had paid £30 each for the privilege. The staff were dismissive and we went in at different times of the day and night. There was never any hot or cold canapés. When we asked the member of staff he was quite rude. Also I had to pay a £100 payment for access to the fridge/mini bar in my room. We didn’t use the mini bar and was advised on checking out, that I would receive a refund in 10 days. The member of staff said you should have been told. If you use a credit card it doesn’t get charged to your account. I paid by debit card. I thought that was extremely poor. Also tried to call guest services, reception, had to try numerous times to get through.
Negative_reviews: Some of the staffs attitude. However, not all staff were rude and dismissive. Mostly in the executive lounge.
Title: It was adequate but the service let it down big time.

Positive_reviews: Views, location, ambience, breakfast, chill out music playing at breakfast, executive lounge, controls for lights and curtains, friendly staff.
Negative_reviews: Pillows are awful, reception don't answer the phone.

Title: Exceptional

Room_info: Deluxe King Room with River View
Positive_reviews: Location to tube. Beautiful view from our room of the River Thames!! Exactly like the photos presented.
Negative_reviews:
They could provide water for all guests. 
When we checked in, we had a nice reception and when I asked for bottled water he was very kind and gave us bottled water. We appreciated him very much.
When my husband went down the next morning to request bottled water for the Nespresso coffee machine, he was told by another employee that he could not have any unless he signed up to be a member. Seriously? Unfortunately it only takes one employee to spoil the reputation of a high end hotel.
Title: Great location! I would highly recommend this hotel!

Positive_reviews:
I have visited London on three occasions. This hotel was the best one I have stayed in. 
The staff were extremely courteous. Nothing was too much trouble. 
The room was quite spacious.  Decorated & furnished to a high standard. Spotlessly clean. Very comfortable bed. ( I could of done with an extra pillow, but no big deal ) 
I was surprised and impressed by the bathroom.  It certainly had the wow factor. A huge bath and a separate shower.  
When I visit London again, I would definitely stop here.
Negative_reviews: There was only one downside. The smell from the shower drain. It was AWFUL.

Don’t ring you back when you leave messages.
Have got to arrange in advance to use the hotel pool.

Title: I was thrilled to be back

Room_info: Deluxe King Room with River View
Positive_reviews: View from room spectacular
Negative_reviews: Food, not enough English food on evening menu, had to go out to find a place to eat. Breakfast was a farce, it was cold and inedible. We helped ourselves from the self service bar, after ordering fried eggs.  We returned to our table and waited and waited for the eggs but they never arrived. After reminding staff at least  3 times, the breakfasts had gone cold, so we are asked if we could have them reheated, the gentleman took them away to reheat, and then after bringing our plates back minus the fried eggs we were told the eggs would be a couple of minutes, so again we waited, guess what no eggs. by this time breakfast was cold again before staff brought our eggs. We couldn't eat the food by now, so did complain to a male member of staff who said he would speak to the manager. We were offered to choose something from the a la Carter menu, which would be free of charge, but there was nothing on this menu that remotely came close to an English breakfast. We cancelled breakfast for Sunday morning as I wasnt prepared to pay another £32 for two breakfasts after the farce we encountered on Saturday morning. This was supposed to be a celebration weekend for our golden wedding anniversary, but it was ruined for us. Suffice it to say, we will  never book to stay at your hotel again.
Title: Very disappointing

Room_info: Studio Double Room with Sofa Bed
Positive_reviews: The location was perfect!
Negative_reviews: No bathrobe or slippers in the room. The view was just a big concrete grey building.

Positive_reviews: I really had fun in this hotel. They upgrade my room cus my first had prob in the A/C when I check in. I enjoyed at night at the rest down esp Every night they have show. Enjoyed the italin show : Francesco _filizzola.
Negative_reviews: Some of the staff are rude. At the check out i was taking pics for the hotel down and one of the staff asked me to stop taking pics and delete what i toke!! By bad way. I asked the reciprion to have late checkout she was v upset and said no i’m not allowed to put my user and we are fully booked by unpolite way. The room doesnt have frigider I can keep my stuff in. It was weird.
Title: Good

Room_info: Studio Double Room with Sofa Bed
Positive_reviews:
Very luxurious and clean.
Due to my daughter being admitted to St Thomas' I wasn't able to spend the night.  My husband and eldest daughter did and found it very comfortable.  Your staff allowed me to freshen up once we were discharged, even though this was after the check out time.  Your staff were excellent.
Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews:
We arrived to the hotel 2hrs before the possible check in, but the lady at the desk was so lovely that not only served us earlier but also gave us an upgrade with free breakfast (it was a gift for Mother's Day last week). Thank you again Kind Lady :)
The hotel is very classy, breakfast are good with a great staff welcoming and serving you within seconds, the room is super modern but the bathroom needs adjustments (one door that you can slide- either for the shower or the toilet - extra weird).
The location is perfect, walking distance to Westminister (max 15mins).
Surely recommended!

Negative_reviews: Didn’t know how to draw the curtains but that was my issue and not the Hotels
Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: Good location
Title: Value for good location

Positive_reviews: Location was great! 7-10 min walk to Vauxhall tube station, 10-15 min walk to Houses of Parliament. Room and shower were very modern and clean, bed comfortable. Staff is friendly and efficient.
Negative_reviews: The breakfast was not worth the money. Very limited choices, poor quality of food. There are no other options next to the hotel, but you can find a lot of cafes within 10-15 min radius.
Title: Would stay there again, just have breakfast somewhere else.

Positive_reviews:
Only had one night at the hotel.  
This is very nice hotel on the south bank in easy walking distance of the city and it’s sights.  The room was very comfortable and spotless.  All the staff were polite and helpful.  Our limited time at the hotel meant we didn’t use any of the facilities so can’t comment.  The restaurant with its large glass front overlooking the river was very cool.  Parking was available at a really good rate just round the corner which was a big bonus too.
Title: Great place to stay.

Positive_reviews: The location was perfect for us being close to the river and near the Vauxhall subway station. It seemed like the hotel was busy with mostly people there for business meetings/conferences so we felt a little weird being dressed for vacation while everyone else were dressed in suits. The room was great- bed very comfortable.
Negative_reviews: There were a couple of early mornings/late nights when fire alarms went off for a short time and then went silent. I wasn't sure if they were testing the alarms but we never heard whether there was a real fire.
Title: It really was the best experience.

Room_info: Studio Double Room with Sofa Bed
Positive_reviews: Reception staff were very friendly, especially with my children.  They each received a children's backpack, which they loved.
Negative_reviews: The lighting system for the room is on a one remote system, but there were only a limited number of options for the lighting "scheme" for the room (i.e., how many lights were on at one time).  It would have been better to have the ability to turn on individual lights in the room.
Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: Loved the bedrooms, very comfortable; location was excellent
Negative_reviews: I didn’t like getting moved out of breakfast area downstairs to several different locations; felt we were overlooked because of the conferences; also it was my friend’s 60th birthday and I asked if the hotel could do something special for her; I was told yes but nothing done; very disappointing
Title: Happy with our stay but some things could have been handled better; more personalised

Positive_reviews:
Room was nice & spacious 
Bed & pillows very comfortable
Separate bath & shower
Bus stops outside hotel, easy walk to station & houses of parliament
Negative_reviews: The room was very clean when I arrived but daily housekeeping was erratic and I had to ring for supplies (eg more toilet paper) nearly every day.
Title: Good facilities, comfortable,

Positive_reviews: Very comfortable hotel in London at a decent price, although on the south bank there are excellent transport links.
Title: Wonderful

Positive_reviews: Nice place to stay, everything worked and bed was comfy.
Negative_reviews: Nothing
Title: Comfy and clean

Room_info: Studio Double Room with Sofa Bed
Positive_reviews: Was perfect grate value for money
Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: Hotel is right on the Thames near the London Eye and across the river from Westminster and more. The concierge staff makes the trip worthwhile.
Negative_reviews: Attractive but this year had single beds pushed together.  Seemed like I had larger beds with appropriate space in between.
Title: London made accessible.

Positive_reviews:
Superior view of Thames, House of Parliament, London Eye.
The location is great - within walking distance of Big Ben and Westminster Abbey. 
Spacious rooms, big TVs.
Negative_reviews: The breakfast could include more diverse and healthy choices.
Title: Fantastic view

Positive_reviews: The hotel is modern and the room furnishings were of good quality.  The girl on reception Renata was very professional.
Negative_reviews: The first room given had a connecting door. When we arrived the guests next door were really noisy. It was the middle of the afternoon so no quibbles with them, however, the hotel advertises sound proofed rooms. Clearly they aren’t.  I dreaded to think how noisy a group of women would be in the evening, so we asked to be moved.  At $463 a night we were not prepared to be disturbed. After some discussion our request was granted.  It’s a great hotel if you are on business but if you want to see the sights in London, it is too far away.
Title: Modern Hotel but Too Expensive

Positive_reviews: Very convienient location to London, staff were very helpful, room was good, basic even though it was suppose to be a superior room.
Negative_reviews: Had to keep asking for the room to be recleaned, they did a half job every time. Our floor was noisy, with doors banging and noise coming from the other rooms. The lifts took far too long to a activate, everyone was complaining they were taking too long to get to floors.
Title: It was good but would hesitate to recommend the hotel.

Positive_reviews: Very friendly and helpful staff. Great food and a lovely bar. Excellent rooms with everything you need to make your stay wonderful.
Negative_reviews: Nothing.

The mattress and bedding were so comfy. The way it is set out is amazing and the boys loved the remote control for the curtains, lighting and air con. Title: Nice Hotel, probably wouldn’t stay again

Positive_reviews: Love the Hotels location, The  hotel is always clean and well equipped with great WiFi connection for work although the breakfast is expensive its very good and well worth the money and the staff can’t do enough for you in the restaurant.
Negative_reviews: When arriving the reception 1.15pm it was very busy so I joined the Queue (Line) behind three other couples, who where clearly waiting in line. Four other people joined behind me, then after around 10 minutes when i got to the front or the queue an east European Guy decided to jump in front of the people queuing and went to the next available desk. I then said to the guy we are queueing here he said four desks, I said do you think everyone is only queueing for only one of them. The Young Lady Roshel behind the reception  who was also Eastern European made me quit aware that i was wrong for tackling the customer and started Laughing a jocking with him and treated me like a cunt. and she decided she would be as unhelpful as possible. telling me I couldn’t book in for another 40 minutes so take it of leave it. I stay with you Twice a month and normally book in just after 1pm as I run a nightclub which opens at 2pm just a few doors away from the Hotel bringing in Over 600 people every Sunday to the area.  We recommend you as a good place to stay.  Since Brexit (which i didn’t vote for) I have noticed having an English accent can an is a problem and its a problem for some of your reception staff if you don’t want English Guests just say!  not booking again and removing your Hotel from our recomened places and till this is sorted

Breakfast was generally good but we had to go to the basement on the Sunday morning and there were issues with charging the breakfast to my room most days, which was irritating.
The neighbours in the room on the 8th floor were very noisy for most of the Thursday night . We complained to the deputy manager who sympathetic but was going to email me with the explanation. To date I have not had any correspondence.

Title: Very comfortable stay

Positive_reviews: Staff were excellent, courteous and very helpful.  It was a special birthday and they upgraded us without charge.  The room was lovely with plenty of thought gone into the facilities such as dressing gown, slippers etc.   The bathroom was lovely and clean with good quality products such as Elemis - the shower was excellent and the water hot and a good pressure.
Negative_reviews: There was no instructions in the room regarding the coffee maker and no sugar, milk or tea bags in case you needed these too.  The bedside lights worked on a different switch to the other lights which was done by an electronic pad, but we simply could not find this anywhere which meant we had to go to bed with the bedside lights on which disturbed our sleep.  The room had a railway line directly outside the window and this was not shared with us which meant our sleep was disturbed very late at night and also early in the morning.
Title: Overally very good and would defintely stay again and recommend it to others

Positive_reviews: Location & ambience
Negative_reviews: Too much Black deco . Lighting in public areas was very dim.
Title: Very comfortable

Positive_reviews: I am a returning customer , I love the food in the restaurant and the location. Taxis are easy to catch and it's only a short walk to the Tate National Gallery  and very close to Waterloo station .
Negative_reviews: I hate the low lightning everywhere , I find that oppressive and very irritating when you can't read something immediately without searching for a lit area .
Title: Due to the location and restaurant I always return.

Positive_reviews: Good location, clean and modern rooms.
Negative_reviews: Air conditioning was rather cool, unable to set an alternate temp, kept reverting to original.
Title: Modern clean and Good central Londonlocation

Positive_reviews: Large rooms with modern technology touches with the room clean with most of the essentials you’d expect. Also a massive bed which was very comfy.
Negative_reviews: Breakfasts was a bit of a minefield especially on Sunday for the Marathon. For major events it needed to be better organised. Monday’s hot buffet breakfast was also cold so disappointing. Some of the service for the type of hotel they are trying to be needs to be improved upon with more attention to detail needed. I felt that there was a lot of staff that were new which probably didn’t help. The room itself could also use some more modern touches with the likes of the old design units which need attention used in what is supposed to be a modern technology hotel. The lifts could also do with attention with us being worried we were going to get stuck every time we were in them.
Title: Nice hotel, but with it being fairly new, it seems to still have a few teething issues to sort out.

Positive_reviews: Chino Latino is great, enjoyed the live music on Friday night. (26th April). The hotel is situated further from tube stations than some of the others (Park Plaza Waterloo for example) but still walkable, on a pleasant stretch of the Thames, although not all rooms have a riverbank view.
Negative_reviews: It was a bitterly cold weekend considering it is late April, particularly following the heatwave of the previous week. It seems that the heating was turned off for summer, meaning that it was cold in the room. We did report this and housekeeping provided a portable electric heater, it took the edge off for a short while until the power sockets ceased working.
Title: Great apart from the inflexible heating/air conditioning system.

Positive_reviews: Staff were friendly and helpful. Good location.
Negative_reviews: When the room was cleaned each day - didnt refresh obvious items like milk, tea bags, shower gel and toilet paper. Had to ask at reception for more items.

Positive_reviews: Nice, clean, modern and calm rooms. Great standard. Great restaurant, delicious foid, reasonable price for quality and service.

Title: Wonderful

Positive_reviews: The staff very friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a great location for sight-seeing. The room was warm and cosy.
Negative_reviews: The English breakfast was cold. Room wasn’t very well cleaned, found false eyelashes on the floor beside the bed (not mine) and coke stains on both the remote controls and beside lampshade. I also reported a leak in the bathroom sink that resulted in our towels always being wet as the water from the sink leaked onto the towels when the sink was used, this was fixed according to a letter from the hotel delivered to our room but this wasn’t the case and the problem remained during our stay. I did report it again when checking out so hopefully the next guests won’t have the same issue.

Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: The room was fantastic. Everything that you could want and more. Very clean and the bed was super comfy. There was a view of the river which was a bonus.The breakfast was similar to other restaurants but was good. There was an option to upgrade at extra cost if required. There is also a health and fitness centre and a pool.
Negative_reviews:
The restaurant servers mostly Asian food and was expensive. I ended up using the bar and the only thing that was within budget was burgers. There are no restaurants nearby and as it was getting late, I was tired, so I went for the burger, which was nice but very expensive for what it was. Unfortunately I wouldn't use the restaurant if I visited this hotel again.
Also  I was hoping to use the pool in the morning, as it was advertised as being open at 06:30, however I went at 06:40 and is was closed which was disappointing.

Title: great

Positive_reviews:
We chose a river view room. The window was floor to ceiling, and the view of the river was fabulous. The beds were comfortable, the bathroom and bath products were great. Over all this was a wonderful room on the 7th floor.
We ate breakfast and dinner at the restaurant upstairs. The food was exceptional. At night there was a different talented singer and piano player. We loved the hotel, and the employees especially Don and all of the concierges. Everyone at the hotel did their best to make our stay the best!
Negative_reviews:
The hop on hop off bus was not what we expected, such as in New Youk, the busses run all day as in LA and other cities. In London the bus stops at 5:00 PM, and we were not told that. If you start at 10:00 in the morning and expect to use the bus until 7:00, find a good restaurant and then take the bus back to your hotel, that is a disappointment. We had to take a cab back to the hotel when the bus stopped in the middle of our route. We won’t use the hop on again in London. We bought a 2 day pass for $80. The second day was horrible too because there was so much traffic we had to wait an hour for the first bus to arrive. We were disappointed with the hop on hop off  based on our other experiences in other cities.  
However, our hotel experience with Park Plaza was the best.

This could have been avoided if the system notified her to avoid our room altogether because the mini bar was locked anyway because we indicated at check in that we didn’t need it and we didn’t leave a credit card.  At check in I also felt the staff could have been a bit more friendly and slightly more personal but it is a busy hotel so maybe they were under pressure. Ah check out, we weren’t even asked how our stay was, there was practically no interaction whatsoever.

Title: relaxing time

Positive_reviews: The breakfast was well worth it.  Nice selection of eggs, cereals, fruit, meats, breads and pastries.  The entire staff was helpful and pleasant.  Very clean rooms, huge TV, and modern electronic messaging (do not disturb, please clean room, etc.).  Good location.  Easy walk to the Westminster Bridge and the London Eye.  The gym is small, but adequate.  The only disappointment was that the beautiful indoor pool was closed.  Since we only had planned on using it that first morning, we did not inquire about the reason or when it would be reopened.  We would definitely stay here again!
Negative_reviews: Perhaps they could change up the breakfast selection--maybe one or two things different each day.  Although everything was excellent, when you are there for 4 or 5 days, it gets a little boring.

Title: Great value for money. Would definitely stay here again.

Positive_reviews: The family was lovely 321, but they need a new sofa bed
Negative_reviews:
We had the family room, which was lovely but my daughter had the bed settee which was so uncomfortable You could feel every spring sticking through the mattress, she had no sleep!
I’d also booked an additional bedroom for my friends and their granddaughter, OMG their serivice was Appalling,  their bedroom wasn’t ready on our arrival this was 3:30 pm no apology from the staff in fact it took them 25 minutes for the reservation team to find their booking to which again no apology, the girls on the reception were also quite rude when one of them whispering into the other girls ear whilst we we’re waiting! Finally the reservation was found and they were told the room was ready 1655! When they got to the room it hadnt been cleaned! So they had to tell the receptionist again the room wasn’t ready, again no apology!  We waited yet again and when they went to the room the sofabed hadn’t been made up for their granddaughter,  so back to reception AGAIN! I also had to make this request for my bedroom.  When we returned later that evening, my friend had no towels, only a hand towel, no soap, shampoo all the little extras most hotel have!  We complained on check out which was pointless, he couldn’t have careless!  This is such a shame because it was the second time we’d visited because it was lovely before, but never again!

Negative_reviews: Ordered fried eggs twice on two mornings, waited 20 mins after asking several times and not receiving them

As they never forget- and thought he had been naughty! Also got to the hotel at 2 (rang ahead to say please can our room be ready for 2 as son was very tired) for check in and room wasn’t ready till 2:55 which meant we had to occupy a very tired child and therefore put back our evening plans.

Also had to go down to reception once over as one of the key cards wouldn't work after we'd been swimming. These requests were all dealt with promptly but just added a little extra stress to the break. We were also disappointed with the swimming pool - lovely setting but very narrow. Couldn't swim due to people 'standing' in there and children playing (no objections on children playing, just would have been better if there was room for a swim lane).

Title: fulfill my requirment

Positive_reviews: Location and modern looks
Negative_reviews: NO WINDOWS TO OPEN the place was so stuffy and the air conditioning was so noisy and would not place the room at a comfy 12' that we like. The Toilet was broken, the bath panel was hanging off, there was still paint in the shower base all on tiles and grout!  we asked to get the toilet fixed and they promised this would be dealt with whilst we went out for the day. On our return 5 hours later nothing had been done, No toilet flush!  They wanted £50.00 deposit for the minibar!  I don't drink but it would have been nice to get a bottle of water as a complimentary gift in the room at the prices they charge for the hotel! The biggest issue was that I ensured, re-confirmed and had a response that car parking was not a problem!   IT COST ME ANOTHER £74.50 to park my car overnight  as there is no car park but there was a concierge who drove the car away. Then I was told I had to pay the congestion charge having avoided it getting to the hotel by driving from the south of the river. The hotel was nice but I would rather have stayed at an IBIS or premier inn, Complete rip off.

Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: Convenient location.
Negative_reviews: This is the second time I have stayed here for work, and staff attitude really leaves a lot to be desired. Too many incidences to describe but with 2 examples - I had an unexpected knock at my hotel room door close to 10pm at night, and was accused of not paying for my meal, and even though I said I had, was accused again so I turned around, showed the receipt and all they could say was - 'oh- well we need to take a copy of that receipt'. No apology for the accusation. Second example -  staff removed my personal food from the fridge (including unopened packets of food). I phoned and complained. They returned the food after it had been sitting in their staff fridge all day, waiting for someone to eat it! All they could say was ' the housekeeping staff must have though you had checked out' and my response - well, that is a bit odd given my luggage and all personal items were there in the room.
