Curtains held to track at one end with giant paper clips, not very professional for such a posh hotel.
Title: Good

Positive_reviews: Part of the Park Plaza chain of hotels, which all have a similar polished feel with door staff at the entrance. I always try to book a Park Plaza hotel if my budget allows and usually you can get a decent price at either the Riverbank, Waterloo or Westminster Bridge. Although out of the three, I prefer Riverbank, since Waterloo backs onto the train line and Westminster can be very busy, especially at check-in. The rooms are nicely appointed, modern and very clean, check in staff are always friendly and they have a decent gym, pool and room service. I haven't had breakfast here and I imagine it's similar to the other Park Plaza hotels nearby which usually have a good selection of choices. It's also a nice walk along the Thames to my office near Blackfriars which takes about 25mins and also really close to HoP, Westminster Abbey, London Eye etc... all within 20min walk away if you're sight seeing. I definitely recommend.
Negative_reviews: Nothing, all good!

Negative_reviews:
- the surface of the desk under the glass covering it needed to be cleaned; not a big issue 'cause the glass on it was clean
- the bathroom had few easy, comfortable, convenient bars where to fix the towels 
- an accessory beside the closet was broken and not repaired and not beautiful to be seen 
- the toilet brush was totally absent 
- Impossible to talk by phone from my room phone and with my mobile phone too with the reception; I had to call a lot of other services of the hotel, to wait on line, to hope that some one will call the reception for me and, finally, I had to go by myself till the reception to fix a pair of issues (minibar and a personal request to have a mouse for the notebook)
- the minibar, even if pre-paid at the reception, had to be unlocked when I was in the room; no one answers the phone so I had to dress myself and to go to the ground floor to ask to unlock my minibar
- phone communications not working well
- a person dressed as a member of the hotel staff between the hotel door and the taxi always pretending money whenever you were leaving or coming back to the hotel during the day; I was going out and coming back more times every day and this was boring and really expensive

Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: Loved the room and the view which was a River view and exceptional.  The beds were wonderful and the staff were very polite - especially the doormen.  It is a magnificent property in a superb location. The breakfast room was lovely with a superb vista,.
Negative_reviews: The breakfast was amongst the worst I have ever had in a hotel.   The eggs were what I would call 'fake eggs' clearly derived from a processed liquid.  The bacon was almost raw and unchewable.  The bread for toasting was the cheapest type of bread with no flavour and easily burned in the toasting machine.  The whole breakfast eating experience was extremely disappointing.  Having experienced this, it would put me off booking with breakfast again and would also put me off dining in general as there was no care taken in the food prep.  The hotel and rooms with its glorious surroundings deserved so much better. What a shame!

View from the dining room was very good, good breakfast.
comfortable beds

Blue lights on switches by bed kept switching off and on in the night - very distracting.
china cup   in room (good) but one was cracked and not replaced
shower taps not clear which was which - hot or cold, up or down, off or on.

Title: Very Good

Positive_reviews: We liked the location, the cleanliness, the modern room, comfortable beds!

The swimming was also a lovely time for us to spend with our child.

Title: Comfortable hotel in a good location.

Positive_reviews:
Great location - 10min walk from Vauxhall bus/tube station - and facing the river. Nice and friendly staff (check-in, checkout, concierge, doorman, etc) always with a smile. 
Nice medium size comfy room (we had a free uppgrade for a higher floor which was really nice and highly pleasant), very nice indoor pool and great restaurant and bar. Wi-fi is fast and always available.
Negative_reviews:
Cleanliness of the room could be a bit better... 
Also a unfortunate mishap with a staff member which was rude and misbehaved at the 12th floor executive club premises: We were upgraded to a executive room and assumed that we could visit the executive club floor. The employee loudly and rudely informed us that we could not be there(!) unless we buy access. When we remarked that his tone and volume were not appropriate, he mockingly appologised and commented the issue with other guests in the room.

Title: Nice weekend break - could have stayed longer.

Positive_reviews:
The staff were all very polite. 
The bed was very comfortable. 
The pool was clean and open until late. Wish it was 24hrs but that’s alright.
Negative_reviews: I didn’t like that I paid extra to have something in my room, and I didn’t have it. I really didn’t like my view. I had another building directly in front of me. And the controls to open and close the curtains were not working. I had to keep getting up.
Title: Excellent

Positive_reviews: The position of the property is absolutely brilliant, perfect, easy to get to by card. The staff are very nice, the Dutch lady on the front desk was the perfect balance of friendly and efficient. Alejandro and Dillon at the Concierge desk were great ambassadors for the hotel. The person responsible for valet parking was great, efficient, did what he said he would do, when he said that he would do it, and very helpful. The breakfast included in my booking was good. Overall, given the location, qualities of the property, and the very good staff I would say that I had outstanding value for money. I would not hesitate to stop at this property again.
Negative_reviews: Nit picking items: The tables in the restaurant for breakfast were too low down for pretty much anyone over five feet tall, the chairs at the tables were very stylish, but enormous, but very heavy, and not really suitable for a breakfast table. My biggest critiques were, my room was next to the Service Life and was noisy, with the headboard on the life shaft wall. Reversing the layout of the bed and TV would pretty much fix that. Exterior bin service started at 5:50 AM, not the best start to the day. Just don't get room 237!
Title: Exceptional overall value for a very well run hotel in a superb position.

Title: Excellent

Positive_reviews:
We had a great stay and thought the hotel was beautiful.  The breakfast was lovely and the view from the restaurant was spectacular.  As there was not an upgrade available we was offered a complementary drink in the 12th floor executive bar and enjoyed the view from the balcony. 
We would definitely return .
Title: Relaxing

Positive_reviews: The ratings reflect my opinion. Overall Excellent.
Negative_reviews: Just two minor points. First, as an elderly couple we felt that the allocation of the room could have been given a little more thought at reception and not allocated a room with a baby "Play/Sleep" cot in it which we could not fold up and place out of the way. It took up too much room, particularly as it was not requested at booking. Second, coming to London for a one night stay it would have been nice to have a room with a view. However, as this was a gift from a sister in law who organised an event, we believe it met all other aspects and requirements. Finally, you could make provision for Coffee/Tea availability in the Reception area. Most elderly people (and disabled people) would like a cuppa after travelling and not have to take escalators, lifts etc to quench a thirst.
Title: Happy to recommend this hotel to anyone.........with alerts re baby cots and coffee!

I look forward to your comments.

Title: Does what it said on the tin

Positive_reviews: We got an Executive Double Room with Riverview. The room was quite spacious and the view didn’t disappoint, as you get to wake up to see Thames, Westminster Palace and Big Ben from your room’s bright large windows. We got amazing service at the reception (thank you, Oana, you deserve a reward!). Large comfy bed, and we loved the spacious bathroom with both bathtub and a shower cabin.
Negative_reviews: TV was awful, with just a few local channels. There were no sanity bags in the bathroom and we got a few tissues that we finished in the first day (I was having a cold) and that were never refilled throughout our stay. Minibar was locked because we paid by debit card at check-in. All in all, it’s a nice hotel, in a good location, but I’m not sure it’s worth the price.

Title: Brilliant

Positive_reviews: From check-in to check-out, we were greeted by friendly staff that helped with all our requests. The hotel seemed very new; it was clean and the room was really comfortable with a big bed, soft chairs and plenty of space. The bathroom, especially the shower, was great and for once the bathrobes were soft - often they are rough and corse so this was a nice surprise. There was also a Nespresso coffee machine which was a massive upgrade from the usual complementary packets of coffee and milk you typically find. The room 'control panel' took a bit of getting used to but once you played around, you could automatically open the curtains and switch between different lighting settings. Overall, it was a lovely experience and we will definitely be returning!

Air con did not work very well (room too warm & took a while to cool down). We had a do not disturb sign on the door yet had a member of staff knocking on the door telling us check out was midday!!! Quite bizarre!!! The telephone rang early in the morning and the room was quite noisy - you could hear banging (not sure where from) & the children in the next room at times. We went to get a drink in the evening - was told they had run out of draft pints but you could have a small bottle for more that the pint cost!!! Not a hotel I would run back to.

We also used taxis a lot to travel to locations further a field, never had to wait for a taxi, there was always a taxi waiting in the hotel taxi parking area. Excellent front of house staff.
Negative_reviews:
The restaurant in the hotel specializes in Asian cuisine. Might need to look else where if Asian cuisine is not to your liking. There is however a good menu selection via room service.
Possibly could use a second bread toasting machine at breakfast to reduce waiting times,
The smart room controls malfunctioned at times. Control panels have a mind of their own, would light up in the middle of the night with no human input.

Title: Perfect place to see the sights from and enjoy the Thames views which is what we all appreciated.

Negative_reviews:
parking was in a nearby hotel.

however we had such a great time we will be going back.
Title: wonderful weekend.

Positive_reviews: Perfect place by the river, with stunning views over Westminster. Easy to get to, easy to get connections to everywhere in no time. We took a 10 min bus to Waterloo, then half an hour either direction on the Tube to Wembley on one end and Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park on the other. The hotel was the ideal place to relax after a hard day’s sightseeing and shopping.
Negative_reviews: One disappointment was the cleaners did not replace the coffee/milk/biscuits each day, leaving my boyfriend with none for our last morning. The bathroom could also do with an upgrade, which I’m assuming they are in the process of doing, given the hammering and drilling coming from the adjoining room.

Positive_reviews:
24 h room service

Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: The staff were very upbeat and happy to help.  The pool was a very welcome luxury.
Negative_reviews: Location was a little bit further out that I thought it would be, but the hotel facilities and staff made up for it.
Title: We had a very enjoyable stay and would probably return

Negative_reviews: Had a lot of problems with key card, four keys issued none of them worked. Not good when wearing killer heels and too much to drink and you have to go back to reception.
Title: Good

Positive_reviews: The staff were great, pity the alarm went off at 5 in the morning and maybe could have compensated customers as many would have been effected
Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: Room was lovely and clean and comfy. Staff very helpful. Location good
Negative_reviews: Foyer ladies toilets were in quite a mess, only 2 of the 3 were usable. Clearly this was only done by those using them, however needs regular checking. Mentioned to staff and they immediately sent someone in so that was great
Title: Very enjoyable

Positive_reviews: The location is perfect! The river room's view. The restaurants.
Negative_reviews:
I paid for a River view room. At midnight (28th-29th Sptember) we had to move rooms because it was freezing cold and the heating did not work, and no heaters were available.
The Reception Manager at night (a lady) told us to wait till she could get a solution. It was nearly 5am and we did not get an answer yet. Poor service. The guy in training (Was it Nahloo? Sorry I don't remember his name), helped us straight away, offered us another a Studio (although it was not river view). He was really helpful and caring. 
We slept just for a couple of hours before going down for breakfast. A couple of hours.
For a 4*/5* hotel, you expect they would take proper care of the guests and not to have them without sleeping till 5am!
It was an important night as we were celebrating Anniversary. It was not as enjoyable as expected, quite disappointed, as I have been another times in this hotel and it was amazing. 
No compensation or apologies offered to us.
Title: Service not as I was hoping. Lovely looking hotel though.

Negative_reviews: Service in hotel bar was rather slow.
Title: Very nice

Positive_reviews: Everything was simply awesome from hotel location , easy check in, gorgeous room with a view, cleanliness, breakfast etc. Staff is friendly and polite. Definitely will come back.
Title: See above

Positive_reviews: Staff was professional and courteous. Concierge desk staff assisted with maps, booking a tour and taxi rides. Beds were comfortable and kettle in the room with coffee and tea supplies was convenient. Not too far from major attractions. For the price, rooms were ok.
Negative_reviews: Overall our 4 nights stay was ok. However, we reserved 2 rooms. We had no problem with one of them but had issues with the second one. After a long day of sightseeing came back to wet carpet 2 days in a row. Front desk staff were responsive and tried to accommodate by switching rooms. However due to lack of communication between cleaning staff and front desk, ended up moving rooms two times one night and three times another night because the rooms we were moved to had not been cleaned after the last guest.

Our kettle frothed with de-scaler!  When we reported this, the staff were apologetic and arranged for us to have a replacement.  However, we had to wait over half an hour to receive it.
  Also, on returning from our meal in the evening, we found other visitors' luggage in our room: two suitcases and a travel bag.

Title: Good

Title: Lovely relaxing stay

Negative_reviews: Bar lacked a little atmosphere and staff there reasonable but not overly welcoming.  Other staff excellent
Title: Really enjoyed the hotel and would definitely stay again

Positive_reviews: Modern hotel with excellent room and facilities. Loved being able to get a coffee in the bar which many hotels lack. Good under cover front area and excellent door staff.
Title: Would happily stay here again.

Positive_reviews: The room size was very good, bathroom was spacious and had good shower/bath and toiletries. Breakfast was really, really good with healthy options and not just the usual stuff. Good espresso in the coffee machine. I ordered food from the restaurant twice for dinner and the food was sent to the room very quickly and it was pretty good, with options to have gluten free and dairy free variants.
Negative_reviews: The staff was at times a bit rude or just not very polite/communicative. A couple of times staff knocked and waited literally 3 seconds before entering - not cool. Cleaning was subpar, could definitely improve considering the overall "classy vibe" of the hotel.
Title: It's a good hotel but staff and cleaning could be better

Positive_reviews: The Room was fine. Only the AC was a little bit louder as expected. The Breakfast was very good, as well as the breakfast room with quite a view of the house of parliaments. With the bus stop in front of the Hotel and the tube in walking range, everything was perfect. When you like to explore the city with the bike, I would recommend the Santander City Bikes.
Negative_reviews:
During our stay were still renovations in progress. That was the only critic point.
Someone could be a little confused by the ambient light, but it worked for me.
Title: Pefect for a City Trip.

Positive_reviews: Really clean, spacious and beautiful space. Also the staff were friendly. Makes for a comfortable stay especially after a long days' course.
Negative_reviews: It was about 15min walk to a train station and given the weather in London, made for quite a walk. It was also quite a travel from the airport/Eurostar. Main downside to the location was that there was no complimentary pick up service to and fro the airport/Eurostar, which would've made the stay hassle free.
Title: Great place, location was within vicinity of ammenities but still a walk from the train station.

Positive_reviews: Excellent service and it really felt like they couldn't do enough for us. We'd booked a room for two but there was only one bottle of water on arrival. They realised this without us letting them know and brought us an extra bottle as well as complimentary biscuits and coffees. An excellent experience and can't wait to stay again.
Title: Excellent service and attention to detail and the staff made us feel extra special.

Positive_reviews: Staff, cleanliness
Negative_reviews: Disappointed that children were not allowed in the executive lounge.  This information was not disclosed during booking or after my booking.  I could not find this information written on any literature in the hotel.
Title: Pleasant stay with welcoming staff.  Clean and great location.

Positive_reviews: Rooms are very spacious, modern and clean. Delighted with the quality and comfort. My room was very quiet and I lived the Elemis toiletries. Room service was efficient and not at all overpriced. I would definitely stay again.

Title: Overall a great place to stay; colleagues were excellent and attentive.  Rooms were extremely clean

Positive_reviews: We were upgraded to a suite that included an excellent breakfast Buffett. All of the staff were excellent except for the housekeeper I had to talk with.
Negative_reviews: Our room was on the side of the train system, so we needed to use ear plugs to be able to sleep at night. The hotel didn’t furnish ear plugs. I accidently  left my iPad in the room and discovered iit 2 days after checkout and we had already left London with no plans to return. I was told my housekeeping that the hotel could not mail my iPad to me even though I offered to pay for shipping. I was told I had to pick up in person or hire a courier service to pick up and mail my iPad. I’ve never been told this ever at 2-3 star hotels, if I left anything behind they would graciously mail me my possession without further requests. I live in the US and our itinerary would not allow us time to go back to London to pick up the iPad,

Title: Impressed

Positive_reviews: The location is superb for regular walks along the river either east into the City, north into Victoria or west into Chelsea and Battersea. The beds are really comfortable. The restaurant is good.
Negative_reviews: With the exception of the staff in the bar/restaurant and the cleaning lady, the staff were generally unfriendly, unhelpful and had little sense of customer care. There were a series of problems during my stay - for instance being locked out of my room with all my luggage and possessions in it - with the hotel denying I had ever been in that room and insisting I had been in a different room 5 floors higher. When this was eventually sorted out, there was no apology nor any explanation given. Until the point they found I was actually telling the truth, it was as though I was making the matter up to inconvenience them. Some serious training in customer care and service is required. Over the weekend, an event in the hotel - possibly a wedding or christening - descended into violence and chaos that spilled over into the lobby and the immediate outdoor surrounds to the hotel. Lots of police appeared, lots of security staff appeared and after a brief period when it all felt a little unsafe, things settled. Again, no acknowledgement or apologies from the hotel management and reception staff.  Frankly, unless you want to be there for its location, I would avoid this hotel until the service offering improves significantly.

Title: Good

Positive_reviews: I've stayed here a few times and generally enjoy it as a place to stay: the location is excellent if you enjoy a walk along the scenic Thames each morning on your way to wherever you need to get to in the city. 5 mins to Westminster, 10 to the SouthBank/Festival Hall, 25 to the Strand, 30 to Chelsea. The beds are superbly comfortable. There was a Nespresso machine in the room which worked despite having bits missing.
Negative_reviews: I paid an additional GBP20/day supplement when I arrived to be "upgraded" to an "executive room" in order to be able to check in early after a 05:00hrs arrival into Heathrow. The room had no view - it looked into a light well, barely any telephone signal, it had no safety deposit box, no bath, it had marked scuffed walls and a raised lump of flooring about 10 x 15 x 50cm in the floor near the desk that meant you couldn't use the full desk area and in addition I kept stubbing my toes on it. I use my own soap bars in hotels - twice in three days, the soap bar disappeared when the room was being serviced. Having had good experiences here in the past, I'd try it again but it was disappointing on this occasion.
Title: Great location and the beds are very comfortable - a little disappointed with the room though

Positive_reviews: We arrived earlier than the scheduled checkin time after on overseas flight and the front desk staff were kind enough to let us check in early! The rooms are very modern and comfy!  The food in the restaurant, breakfast and dinner,  was very good.  It is also the perfect location to walk to the many of the tourist spots.
Negative_reviews: The early checkin was great but the room had not been fully cleaned!  We brought it to the attention of the front desk, went out sightseeing and is was done when we got back...so just a minor detail!
Title: Perfect spot for a 3 Day stay In London

Negative_reviews: I booked a river view room and even though it did have a view it looked out at trees so the view couldn’t be fully appreciated.  I had a room on the 3rd floor so maybe a room higher would have been better....bit  disappointing as the room charge was for “with river view”. I also had to ring room service for one of “the inclusions” as it wasn’t in my room when I arrived.
Title: Comfortable with friendly staff

Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews:
This hotel looked brand new, and the bus boy told us it had been recently renvovated.  The style is modern and shiny and reminded me of Vegas. Lots of shiny stone and surfaces. 
Bed was supremely comfortable and room was spacious. it was a nice surprise to see it was a "smart" room, controls by the bed.  It was nice to control the curtains from the bed. 
The hotel is very close to the London Eye, and once you figure out the buses, it's very convenient. There is a stop at the front door which ferries you to Waterloo Station.  
Hotel was always very clean, and we got a free bottle of water and a bottle of wine, plus a little tray of macarons and chocolate upon check in.  Very nice gesture indeed.  I would definitely recommend it.
Negative_reviews:
sporadic sewage smell from the drains in the bathroom. Complained and front desk sent up a plumber immediately.  The smell went away, but came back periodically. In the end I just shut the bathroom door. It was ok since I was mostly out of the room, but there was a definite plumbing issue. 
Also the bathroom lights automatically shut off after a predetermined time. Twice was in the shower and the bathroom went completely dark. this is pretty disconcerting not to mention dangerous.   I forgot to mention this to front desk .
There are only a few dining options within walking distance, so better to have your meals before going back to the hotel for the night.  The hotel is actually on a rather industrial block.

Title: Great location, comfortable hotel with excellent staff.

Positive_reviews:
The hotel is situated very close to the Thames. It has great views of Westminster especially from the dining area/bar. It's a few minutes walk to all the hustle and bustle but situated far enough away from the noise and chaos which for us was perfect.
The room was very clean and comfortable. The control panels on both sides of the bed were an unexpected bonus. They controlled lights, air con and curtains 😁 as well as a few other things. The hotel provided dressing gowns and slippers and tea and coffee making facilities. The breakfast was great. Buffet style with plenty of choice and very tasty. The staff were polite and helpful and the communal areas of the hotel were always clean and tidy. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to spend the weekend in london. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

The shower diverter / temperature handles have no instructions or markings and it takes a little while to work out what handle sends the water where and what handle controls the heat.
When using the shower, be careful you don't turn the wrong one and get very hot water instead of use of the other shower head.

I was upgraded as a result and went for breakfast which was on the floor I was allocated to only to be told once seated that i should have breakfast downstairs and not on this floor, part of the reason given was to ensure enough tables were available when only 4 seemed occupied from maybe 20 or more. I said I did not see what difference it made where I ate breakfast but they politely argued with me. It was just unnecessary. 
Problems with bookings and charges are too detailed to go into but ruined the experience

The only restaurant at the hotel is very expensive and there is nothing else very close.

Title: Excellent

Positive_reviews: The staff were very pleasant and helpful throughout. We also left our luggage on the last day to pick up later which worked very well. The bed was large & comfortable & had 2 pillows each. It is the quietest hotel we have stayed in in London. Once the door was shut you couldn't hear anything, brilliant! Generally it was a good, reasonably priced, well positioned hotel. We would stay there again. It is handy for a visit to the Houses of Parliament & the surrounding area & an easy walk from Vauxhall tube station.
Negative_reviews: The air conditioning switch at the door didn't work, the other air con switches in the room did work but we only worked it out later. There seemed to be a lot of different switches on various consoles in the room so it was hard to work out what did & didn't work. the lamp by the bed never came on. Simpler would be easier! The kettle leaked quite badly (which we reported so hopefully they have replaced it).

Title: Had a very warm welcome and the location was perfect for me and my son the food Was top!

Positive_reviews:
The room was really big for what I would expect of a central location in London. 
Great views (obviously paying for it - room with river view).
Good location (in front of Westminster area). 
Really comfortable mattress.
Negative_reviews:
Working for years in hospitality, regretfully I must say that our trip was not was I would expect from a 4 star hotel.
It was a special occasion and I requested prior check in what I consider a fair and simple request: to leave a note in the bedroom upon arrival and a room with bath. What is my surprise when at check in, there is no notification received even thought the several emails sent (via booking.com and directly to the property). This said, I would like to personally thank Monica (I believe this was her name if I remember correctly), as she was extremely nice and professional, and she reassured that at least we got the room with the bath. Due to the lack of preparation of my two requests (and even though I really appreciated her work, the room was not cleaned upon arrival and there was dust all over the furniture - not a severe case, but I am allergic to dust & thankfully this was more or less solved the morning after). We received later on some macaroons in the room, I believe thanks to Monica too - Italian speaker - great attention to detail.
I must say that we also got a room in a floor where some maintenance work was getting done, therefore we could find dust, paint, and dirtiness all over the hall, and experienced some maintenance noises during early hours of the morning.
The room did not have a proper table for having breakfast (one chair on a working desk and one sofa with a bed table), which is a shame, taking into consideration the wonderful views and the potential guest experience, so it was not really comfortable or nice to use and pay for the room service (plus, I would like to mention that I personally find ridiculous to charge 21 pounds for a breakfast that is consisted in literally 6 pieces of food - it is weird to provide with a full selection of marmalade but no bread or bun or whatever to spread it...).
Title: Good

Positive_reviews: Nice hotel apart from queuing for breakfast sun morning. We were apparently upgraded which at first we thought great but it wasn't we were at the back near the train line so that's all we heard first thing from 6 o'clock.

After I checked in our room was not cleaned the next day and freezer was not working the bathroom door was not closing and my wife got mad she called front desk they initially offered us 12th floor we dragged our suitcases there and when I reached downstairs to ask for new room they gave us 8th floor which was on other side of the hotel .So again I dragged my suitcases and checked in 8th floor .

Title: Nice but poor value for money due to the spa/pool, bar/restaurant being closed.

Positive_reviews: To get dark terrible room was really disappointed fact at the beginning of our stay. Then after few minutes of discussion with the receptionist they had changed room with the real city view for us.
Negative_reviews:
I have booked the room with the view to the city. The first room they gave us was dark one with the view to the OPPOSITE window of the neighbour room in the inner yard! The hotel sells these rooms as a family rooms with the city view! Be careful to book this hotel. You could get ugly view easily! (1,2d photos)Many rooms have terrible view due to the architecture of the building. 
The rooms with the awesome view are located only at the end of the corridor! 
It was really disappointed fact at the beginning of our stay. Then after few minutes of discussion with the receptionist they had changed room for us (3d photo).
Title: Many rooms have terrible view due to the architecture of the building.

Positive_reviews:
We enjoyed the location - although moved from the Riverbank to the Westminster Hotel (even though to this day you can still book! ) we found the location good.
Great view of the Houses of Parliament from room 1086.
We found the security staff on entry to the hotel friendly and warming. 
Facilities clean although on arrival there was trays outside rooms littering the corridor from breakfast (it was 2pm!)
Negative_reviews:
Staff were cold, unapologetic and the hotel was dated.... the room was decorated with cold leather and outdated hotel facilities. 
In the river view room there was no English plug sockets by the beds for phone charging and the lighting was extremely dark, even with all the curtains drawn. The Bed was ok... not the standard expecting. 
On arrival we informed the staff that the riverbank has been closed for sometime so they should take it off booking.com. It is incredibly misleading to offer a hotel when it’s closed. Completely unacceptable. 
On check out, the staff let a lady push in front of us even though we had been waiting for 10 minutes patiently. Then on complaint they said ‘oh you should just put your key in the bowl...’ no sign to say to do so...
£150 deposit taken for hotel which is in the ‘terms and conditions’... this should be sent in a clear communication beforehand. 
Parking a complete mess outside, difficult to negotiate walking around them.
Single use plastics still be used - this hotel is definitely in need of a makeover and better management. 
Lots of people entering the hotel and walking around with no masks.... felt a little uncomfortable at times as to whether the hotel was taking our health and safety seriously.
All in all.... disappointing.
Title: Cold, Dated and misleading.

Positive_reviews: N/a
Negative_reviews: N/a
Title: Hotel not open !!!!

Positive_reviews: Friendly staff
Negative_reviews: Moved to this hotel, got out in a studio room, told room was bigger but the only thing bigger was that more people could fit in, in the area where our bed was it was smaller than the executive double we booked

Title: Very poor

Negative_reviews:
The breakfast was awful, no taste at all the mushrooms had no flavour, bacon was asked to be well done it came undercooked. 
The bedroom didn’t have mood lighting like said on the booking, there was an ugly picture of a gesha doll rather than the usual nice blue mood lighting wall in other park plazas. 
The check in took half an hour as there was an issue with the booking and change of hotel due to coronavirus. Really unimpressed and disappointed by the hotel.

Positive_reviews: Location
Negative_reviews:
There was confetti in room
Still rude staff dust in bathroom
And rubbish view
Title: Fair

Positive_reviews: Good location, friendly staff, nice antibacterial facilities at reception and great security entering the hotel.
Negative_reviews:
I booked the Park Plaza Riverside Hotel, but you informed me that it is not ready given the precautions required because of Covid-19.
I got an upgrade and moved to the Park Plaza Westminster Hotel. However, room did not look like it was deep cleaned and we did not feel safe.
Given then current pandemic issues, the 2 TV remote controls and other utensils were dirty and I was concerned to use them.
In the bathroom, the shower hose popped out of the shower head and flooded the bathroom floor
Overall I think the cleanliness of the room needs to be a lot better give these current conditions.
Title: Review of Park Plaza Westminster

Room_info: One-Bedroom Suite with Kitchenette and Balcony - River View
Positive_reviews:
The terrace and balcony are great with nice but basic garden furniture out there. The view is great.
The breakfast menu is good because you have lots of options just beware the quality isn't up to much.
The bed is very comfy and the bathroom clean with a decent sized shower.
Negative_reviews:
****** THIS REVIEW IS FOR PARK PLAZA WESTMINSTER, THE RIVERBANK HOTEL WAS NOT READY SO WE WERE MOVED.******
I paid for a suite and received a glorified hall way that could just about fit a bed in... We were sold this as an upgrade from the room I had booked.
I included breakfast in the booking... On the first day this breakfast was an hour late, cutting into our day. When I called down to see why it was an hour late and where it was the staff member was combative as if we had somehow done something wrong to make the breakfast late.
I instructed her that it would be good manners to apologise rather than try and blame us for their obvious failings and she all of a sudden found her customer service hat again and went and sorted it.
When it arrived it was cold and it got even colder as they sent it up to us without any forks which isn't ideal for tackling scrambled eggs and beans.
When I called down for the forks I mentioned it would be rather cheeky of them for that breakfast to remain on the bill nonetheless it did, they obviously see that as satisfactory service.
This was room 1542, if they offer you this room in the guise of a "suite" do not accept it. It's a very narrow odd shaped room and the only decent thing about it is the terrace and the view which at night is brilliant.
Check in and check out both bang average.... I had no photo id on me at check in and so the guy made a big deal of it and basically tried to make out he was doing me a favour letting me stay there for the £450 I was paying for 2 nights.
On check out we weren't even asked how our stay was which is just as well really because I'd probably still be there now.
We were up on the top floor, with the room being so small and narrow we were obviously going to want to enjoy the terrace.... To do this you have to drag yourself down 15 floors again to fill out a form and get a key.... Because naturally they couldn't have mentioned this at check in!!
Title: Underwhelmed is an understatement.

Negative_reviews: Presented with food that I said I had an allergy to.
Title: Disappointing

Positive_reviews: I think it’s shocking how I have been charged twice for this hotel £604 £302 £302 of two of my credit cards neither the hotel or booking.com have sorted it out over a week now it’s disgusting
Title: Bad

Positive_reviews: Safe not working reported three times stained carpets in room that was supposed to be exec suite.
Negative_reviews: The cleaner must have been in roller skates as she spent very little time client. No refreshes sugar tea etc despite leaving a note!
Title: Disappointing

Positive_reviews: Location
Negative_reviews:
1st attempt to access room on 11th floor,  key card did not work
2nd attempt to access room successful, however room not vacant, still occupied!
3rd attempt, different room accessed successfully, however TV turned on OK but would not turn off, volume could not be changed, remote totally kaput.
Informed reception about the TV who assured us that it would be sorted while we spent the afternoon sightseeing.  On returning back up to the 11th floor guess what, TV not fixed! Called reception from the room and told it would be sorted ASAP, 1 hour later back down to reception to complain and were given yet another room.
For a 1 night stay we were given 3 different rooms, this place was like a plate glass Faulty Towers!
Title: Smart hotel, incompetent staff

Negative_reviews: When you speak to the reception staff about an issue you have in your room, you would expect to hear an “i am sorry to hear that. Let me see what I can sort out”. You don’t expect to hear “no, that cant be done” and then watch them walk away.
Title: Pleasant

Negative_reviews: The room was filthy, towels were covered in dirty, the microwave had caked on food, the bed sheets had stains as did all the furniture. The pool was dirty and the steam room smelled terribly and the ceiling of it was peeling off. Very bad standards and maintenance.
Title: I used to stay here many times in years gone by, but standards have dropped tremendously.

Positive_reviews: The hotel was really lovely and the staff were friendly and the hotel is in a good location.
Negative_reviews: The air conditioning was not working properly in my room which meant that I couldn’t sleep properly all night due to it being too hot. We had to call reception at 3am and two different people had to come in at two different times to try and open the window. When they were unable to do so a third person had to come in to deliver a fan - which was very loud and constantly making a creaking sound as there was a problem with it. I had to turn this off in the end and manage as best as possible for the next couple of hours. Not ideal when you have paid for a good night’s sleep and have a work event early the next day!
Title: Sleepless.

Positive_reviews: Breakfast was excellent with friendly staff and excellent view of the River
Negative_reviews:
Noise from building works, very dirty windows and problems with unlocking mini bar. The walls are so thin you can hear every word from next door. 
Expected better given the price paid and the prosteage of the hotel. When asked if we enjoyed out stay, I replied no. The repection ask why, I replied that I was surprised they asked after the number of times we had spoke to them, they removed the charge of one small drink from the mini bar and said sorry. Well guess that's their opolgises!
Title: No comment

Positive_reviews: The building itself was so impressive! The staff were very nice and professional
Negative_reviews: Our rooms were never properly cleaned. Just making the bed isn’t cleaning the room for three nights. No fresh towels or taking rubbish out of the room. The restaurant on valentines night was a disaster. Food was atrocious . Myself and my partner were given our main courses 15 minutes apart from each other and when we both had our meals on front of us we had to try flag someone down for cutlery. Even though the staff weren’t too experienced they were very polite which is something I’ll give them. Breakfast no flavour probably wouldn’t return

Positive_reviews: The general aesthetic of the hotel and the room is nice.

the curtains in my room were broken. The kettle was broken. The hairdryer was missing. The controls for the lights/room were good but the  panel keeps lighting up, or not turning off which is annoying for trying to sleep
It wasnt clear whether the water in the mini bar was free or now.
When i ordered a new kettle it took them 90 minutes to bring it which is far too long so I didnt bother telling them about the other pieces that they had wrong.

Negative_reviews: Hotel did not honor rate available for upgrade with Booking.com. when agent try to reach hotel they completely disregarded rate available online.

Room_info: One-Bedroom Suite with Balcony and River View
Positive_reviews:
The bed was very comfortable and the hotel very nice.
I had a problem with one of the rooms and Juana quickly solved it. She is a really lovely lady.
Negative_reviews: The horrible cleaning for how expensive the hotel is, disappointing my father's birthday present was a suite for two nights and it was very dirty it wasn't too nice
Title: Fair

Room_info: Studio Double Room with Sofa Bed
Positive_reviews: The hotel was in a great location. Some of the staff were extremely helpful; The general ambience was great.  The children enjoyed the swimming pool.
Negative_reviews:
The cleanliness of the room was awful. They hadn't replenished the mini bar, (half empty wine bottle and half finished bottle of milk remained in the fridge from the previous occupants). The floor hadn't been cleaned as there were crumbs and a grape left on the carpet - even after requesting the room to be tidied again. There were a pair of earphones also left in the children's bed! So begs the question, had the sheets even been changed? 
I had followed this up with reception upon checking out and as yet,  Four days later and I have yet to receive a response from the hotel. 
The bathroom sliding door wasn't operational and the vegetarian options provided for the evening meal and portion sizes in the restaurant was also slightly lacking; my partner left still hungry.
Title: Some staff provided exceptional customer service; expected better levels of cleanliness!

Positive_reviews: Very clean and staff very nice. The bar area was nice.
Negative_reviews: The room had no view and looked into other rooms. to get privacy you had to have the curtains drawn the whole time and lights on. It was very gloomy and no natural light. Felt like we were in a box.
Title: Nice to get away and everything apart from room was good

Positive_reviews: The location is great and a short trip away form the west end. The portal outside was helpful and assisted my wife whilst we parked. Hotel seems cleaned.
Negative_reviews:
Customer Service was very poor. We rang reception (and other numbers) over 10 times to get assistance, no one picked up. Room was not finished. TV did not work. Heating did not work. Cleaners came in whilst we were still in bed. For our troubles the hotel said they would bring us a bottle of wine, we never received it. Breakfast was poor, and the staff are not trained well. All students and talk among themselves. 
I don't usually write reviews, but this was an exceptionally poor experience from start to finish.
Title: Probably the worst hotel we have stayed in for Customer Service.

Negative_reviews:
Corridor leading up to the room was filthy. 
Bathroom was not very clean!!!!

(I’m blonde) and not to forget I left my phone charger behind after check out and called up 2 hours later to ask for them to hold on to it as I’m coming right back to pick it up and guess what charger must of been stolen by a member of staff as the charger was not found and handed in. Title: Disappointing

Title: Fair

We paid for a room with a nice view, instead they gave us a cold room with a terrible view of a train track and council estates. My boyfriend and I have stayed at a number of hotels, however with this one we were very disappointed. We will not be staying again or recommending this hotel to anyone.
Title: Fair

Positive_reviews:
Staff were friendly and attentive. Had a great second evening in the hotel bar - good music. Comfy bed and pillows.
Spa facility was a great bonus.
Negative_reviews:
The room wasn't what was expected - we were put in a disabled room which didn't have a bath. Something we were hoping for and advertised to us. We asked for another room with a bath but because it was late the hotel was fully booked. Even though the receptionist was trying to get us to pay to upgrade when we checked in.
Food was expensive and not good value for money. I.e. £5 for two vegetable gyoza. Or a bottle of house red for £34..!
Title: Valentine's weekend

Positive_reviews:
We enjoyed the lighting, the comfort of the shower and bed.
We also enjoyed the free WiFi, which was faster than anticipated.
We liked the location with it being close to various amenities.
Negative_reviews:
We didn't like the cleanliness of the room when we first walked in.
We didn't like the cleanliness of the bathroom - there were noticeably used bottles of shampoo.
There was a miscommunication with the swimming pool, which was one of the reasons we chose the hotel and paid extra for, both in the evening and the following morning.
The receptionists we had deal with us in the evening and the morning weren't overly welcoming or feeling happy - that said they were the only 2 people we dealt with that made things challenging. Everybody else was joyful and welcoming.
Title: Certainly not the best but it could've been much worse

Positive_reviews: The location and cleanliness.
Negative_reviews:
I’ve booked for two separate beds.  But they gave me a room with a single bed.  I called them immediately to change  the room, they told me that they would send someone to separate the large bed for two separate beds, that was around 3:30 pm.  I went out after that and I came back at 10:30 pm, but they did not separate the bed, and the air conditioning was not working, which is another problem.  After several attempts to contact them, they sent room service to separate the bed.  After a while, the technician on air conditioning came and after examining, it became clear that there was a malfunction with air conditioning, and the room must be changed.  The room was changed around 12:40 in the morning !!  We were very tired, and although the air conditioning in the room that was replaced by us was not different from the first room, as the air conditioning was making a disturbing sound we had to sleep because of the extreme tirednes. 
For fairness, after complaining and meeting the duty official, he apologized and offered us breakfast as a kind of hospitality.  However, due to extreme exhaustion, we were unable to get up early.  
In general it was a bad experience, and I do not intend to return to this hotel again in the future.
Title: Disappointing

Positive_reviews: Good view over the river
Negative_reviews: Room was filthy! View in room over looked by apartments next door! Maid walked in, in the morning! Breakfast was ok but hash browns were under cooked not good value for money!
Title: Room was filthy

Title: Dissappointed

Room_info: Studio Double Room with Sofa Bed
Positive_reviews:
I was disappointed in the stay. First, our room was dirty. There was a half pack of eaten cookies in the area of the coffee maker, and used Q-Tips on the floor by the garbage can. 
It was nice they had set up the pull out coach as a bed for us. At checkin the woman didn’t explain anything about how the pool worked, even though I’d asked about hours. She also didn’t tell us checkout time or any other info. The man at the pool was very helpful.
Negative_reviews: In addition to the uncleaned room, the pool is not really a pool for kids/families. It’s more like a spa pool, and you have to reserve a time to swim and only 6 kids at a time. Not what we were expecting and I wish the website had noted that. We were specifically looking for a pool :-/
Title: Okay

Positive_reviews: Good clean hotel in a good location for us.
Negative_reviews: Nice hotel but we wasn’t given a great room.  We were given a disabled room, the bathroom floor was soaked after showering as it wasn’t a regular shower, also we were over the railway, not the best view and woken this morning by the trains!
Title: Pleasant

Positive_reviews: N/A
Negative_reviews: Very unwelcoming!!  When I arrived they wanted to see photo ID (I'd stayed the week before, wasn't asked for then, I even have their loyalty card) which they then took away and copied (I presume).  I asked why - "It's our policy for all booking.com customers". I also said I wanted a receipt on departure. "We can't give you one because you booked through booking.com". I'd had the same problem last week and in the end emailed booking.com, who emailed Park Plaza, who emailed me a receipt.  What a waste of eveveryone's time!  So I persisted ("It's not our policy") and said I had eventually got one from the previous week ("Well that's not how I've been trained").  The Asst Manager came out.... "It's not our policy, we can't do it because the rate you pay is different from our agreed price with booking.com".  So I showed him last week's invoice - which showed exactly the same amount!  He grudgingly agreed they would provide one on departure (which they did).  Later I went to the bar to get something to eat.  The Maitre d' greeted me and told me to sit anywhere.  The one free table (for 2) was in the window, set for food, so I sat down.  Within 30 seconds he was back telling me I couldn't sit there, that was for the restaurant menu, I'd have to sit at the bar.  So I moved to the bar and he brought me the bar menu.  Then ignored me.  As did the other waiting staff.  I eventually spoke to a passing waitress..... "I'll get one of the bar staff to take your order".  Nothing.  Eventually after nearly half an hour I decided there were more deserving places to spend my money so I went to the burger bar under the railway arches down the road where the service was a million times better than this so-called 4-star hotel.  I stay in hotels on business every week, and I don't think I have ever been made to feel so unwelcome as at the Riverbank Park Plaza.
Title: Very unwelcoming, clearly don't like booking.com guests!

Positive_reviews: Room was big.
Negative_reviews: Inflexible staff who were not interested in customer service.  I ordered food from an outside vendor and the front of house refused to bring it up or let the delivery guy do it.  I was on a conference call and had to let my food go cold.
Title: Poor

Negative_reviews:
On our first day when we returned to our room the housemaid had left the dirty sheets on our floor. They also left dirty glasses and didn’t replace them. We tried to make a room service order and were trying to get through for 40minutes when someone eventually answered we were asked to call back in 10 minutes they were busy. We called back and placed an order and sat up for over an hour and the food never arrived.
On our second day we returned after being out for the day and our bed was made so poorly, the sheets were also very badly creased. Photos below of what our bed was made like when we returned. (Btw the maid had placed the items on the bed like this.)Remember this is supposed to be a 4 Star Hotel.
Title: Not up to the standard of a 4 star hotel.

Positive_reviews: One of the worst hotel, their staff is so so annoying! They don’t speak well, we waited for hours in their restaurant and no one was their to ask us, food arrived lately with no forks!
Negative_reviews: Nothing
Title: Worst vibes

Positive_reviews: Location
Negative_reviews: The staff are awful in this hotel. You literally could not make this up. I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights upon moving to London for the first time. I had driven quite a long way and had a lot of luggage. Instead of being helpful the doorman proceeded to sneer and say "you have 30mins". How about a welcome to London!? I then asked him if there was anywhere to tye up my bike and he actually rolled his eyes, laughed, sneered again and said he didnt know. (It was visible from where we were standing). The room was above average, but the cleaner did a rubbish job - removing dirty cups and glassses without replacing them. We went down to restaurant and were served food which was still partially frozen!!! We then had to wait 30mins to pay our bill. Upon going to the spa there were no towels available on 2 x occasions, when I spoke to reception about it, the receptionist made fun of my accent before resolving the problem. Upon checking out of the hotel; the staff made a huge fuss about storing our bags. We actually had to bribe the bellboy in order to get this stored. This is a lovely hotel, in a great location but the staff are beyond a joke.
Title: Fair

Negative_reviews:
The breakfast was not very good 
Quality of food was poor. Eggs were awful. Cheese and ham sat out and was starting to curl up as it was not refrigerated . We paid for breakfast before we booked but eventually ate out as it’s was so poor
Title: Pleasant

Positive_reviews: Room looked nice, shower was good, reception looked nice
Negative_reviews: Bed was very hard and pillows were very hard. Very uncomfortable nights sleep.
Title: Pleasant

Negative_reviews: Room decor was 'tired and worn', no soap in bathroom so had to ask for some. Tea/coffe/ sugar not well stocked, not enough for 2 people. Broken glass and spilt juice in a drawer from previous occupants and not cleaned. Not enough normal height tables for breakfast, have to sit at low tables and stoop forward.
Title: Fair

Negative_reviews:
Staff seem inexperienced and not helpful. Some were rude.

Title: Nice hotel, staff need more training

Positive_reviews: The hotel has good location not far from Underground (about 7 min. to walk) and Westminster (about. 15 min. to walk). We ordered the Executive room and the room was quite big with bath, shower, armchair, table with chair and coffee machine. The room has good lighting.
Negative_reviews: The breakfast not so good standard breakfast and hot dishes you can order for additional price. I ordered Executive room and asked the room with view. In result we received room with view on wall. I asked to change it, but girl on reception said there is no free rooms. I stayed in this hotel before and had a better view. The room was very shabby. The hotel certainly has problem with maintanance. 2 showers was leaking and 1 absolutely can't be used for washing. The sink was with crack, The mirror with big scratch. The pin on toilet bowl was broken, the trash bin was broken. Also service in restaurant was very low. We were waiting very long our bill and were mixed up the drinks which we ordered.
Title: Fair

Positive_reviews: The hotel itself was lovely. Well located and easy to get to and from.
Negative_reviews:
The AC in our room was broken so the room was uncomfortably hot for the whole stay. The curtains were broken so one didn't close properly. We ordered room service and when our chicken wings arrived they were cooked thoroughly - raw chicken in some cases. When we complained about this, we were told the duty manager would be informed and come back to us - they didn't. 
The spa was beautiful, although we weren't able to use it as the pool area was full of families with kids - less of a spa and more like a community pool which we weren't expecting. 
All in all it just wasn't the standard of stay I was expecting.
Title: Underwhelming

Positive_reviews: Hotel location and room
Negative_reviews:
Nearly all of the staff were quite stand offish, especially the ones in reception. It was also the same in the bar Nobody smiled apart from the guy who helped me into the taxi when I was leaving
It doesnt cost anything to greet someone with a smile
Title: Pleasant

Negative_reviews: I am very embittered by the treatment received by the hotel management, I would dare to say total indifference, I mean. Arriving in the night I found a room completely frozen despite having put the air conditioner to the maximum, after half an hour the environment was always very cold. So I went to sleep freezing all night. Besides that I spent a night in white also for the noises of the elevator. The next day I asked to move to another room and unfortunately, returning in the night, I found myself in a suite where the air conditioning worked in the living room but not in the bedroom. The next day, I again reported the matter to the reception asking for a resolutive intervention, in all senses including the dispute of the payment unfortunately anticipated with Booking provider, on the problem suffered, however there was no intervention by the Management to reconcile the unfortunate situation that has arisen. Bad behavior!
Title: Poor

Positive_reviews: Nice room, though noisy
Negative_reviews: Unable or unwilling to provide a VAT receipt, every other hotel where I book through booking.com are able to do this so why not Park Plaza? I will now have great difficulty reclaiming the cost from my company.
Title: Won't provide a receipt!

Positive_reviews: nothing about the experience was positive
Negative_reviews:
Worst handing of a booking ever. wouldn't help me move the date, kept saying only booking.com could move it. when i spoke to booking.com they said they were happy to move it but couldnt get an answer by phone from the hotel. they asked me to asked the hotel to call them. i rang the hotel back but they refused to call booking.com as its not their policy? they also said booking.com shouldn't be calling them its done by email. i rang booking.com back and they said they cant do anything without the hotels permission. i rang the hotel again and they said they cant do anything without booking.coms permission and i wold be charged for a stay i never had. shocking behaviour on both parts. will never use either again.
i have owned many hotels and used booking.com at all my sites and i do what i want, booking.com would never stop me making amendments or date changes.
Title: poor service from both the hotel and booking.com. wouldn't use either ever again.

Positive_reviews: Nice modern hotel. Good location for tourists. Good bar restaurant.
Negative_reviews:
Shower didn’t work, the valve came off completely and just spurted uncontrolled water so I squatted in the bath.  
Hairdryer didn’t function. Also asked if I could get a shaving kit using the reception phone but nothing was followed up on. Items in the room bar were astronomical £4 for a small jar of peanuts!
Staff weren’t to keen on me sitting alone in the restaurant by the window overlooking the Thames and wanted to move me to a bar high stool to eat from the bar menu.  Irritating and nonsensical (though I guess a couple or family would have tipped higher)  so I left and went to a local supermarket for a take away sandwich, beer and a razor. Glad it was just a one night business trip.
Title: Nice modern hotel. Good staff. Poor attention to detail.

Title: Nice hotel spoiled by the machinery noise

Positive_reviews: The location was good. The concierge was lovely.
Negative_reviews: When I arrived at 9pm there were no double rooms available. When I complained I was offered a room but when I arrived it was clearly a sofa bed and not a full bed. The room I stayed in was on the 13th floor and the the windows overlooked the hotel air handling vents. This room was very noisy and I had great difficulty sleeping through the constant loud hum of the vents. On checking out I was not offered any compensation for my difficulties.

Title: Okay!

Positive_reviews: Nothing, the service was appalling and the room very tired.
Negative_reviews: There was a mix up with the booking that led to my teenage daughter being let into someone else’s room at 11pm at night, instead of just issuing another room, they kept us all waiting at reception for over 30 mins to sort why it had gone wrong despite my explanation that we had to be up at 4am to run an event.  At checkout there was another mix up the following day which made us late.  Staff were not remotely apologetic, despite our booking being over £2k total (7 rooms)shocking!
Title: Appalling

Positive_reviews: Very noise air con had to change rooms
Title: Pleasant

Positive_reviews: Room was good and a nice size, unfortunately the view was next door so nothing very pleasant. The bars were nice albeit expensive. Decor was very trendy and modern, staff that I interacted with were pleasant. Good location on the south bank and only a stroll to the London eye and associated places like Sealife and the London dungeon. Only a little further was the BFI Odeon which is worth watching a film at as it’s the largest screen in the UK. Lots of bars and restaurants nearby with plenty to choose from.
Negative_reviews: The bathroom wasn’t very clean it had some clumps of dust and hair that had been left on the floor. Just my preference but I like to see something out of a window rather than a similar building about 15 foot away, there was no chance of booking a preferred room and if necessary paying extra for it. We paid for the superior room to incorporate breakfast for an extra £25 as opposed to £22.50 each if you paid separately at the hotel, we found the breakfast awful!!! The bacon was congealed together and tasted very strange? There was also some insipid sausage along with some bland scrambled eggs, the hash brown was nice but the beans tasted of an inferior nature to a ‘standard’ type. There were only plates at the warm buffet so after queueing at the continental section, because the cooked breakfast was inedible, we had to go round again after fetching a plate because they didn’t have any there. We had to wait for ten minutes for one of the rare waiters to fetch a small jug to put milk in for our tea and coffee, when we did get some the coffee was like sludge and not very nice so went for the machine version and dutifully queued with 6 other guests for one o the machines whilst a similar number queued for the other machine, getting down the last two we were then told the machine had stopped working so had to join the back of the other queue!!! I decided to have a latte and a cappuccino but upon returning couldn’t taste any difference between the two as they were both really poor. My advice would be to not bother with breakfast as it was really bust and definitely not worth the wait, go out and find somewhere else. My last moan is we were unceremoniously woken at 03:45 in the morning by someone trying to get into the room opposite by tapping, banging, slapping and shouting to the occupant all to no avail, in the end I had to tell him to go down to reception to get them to attract the attention of whoever he was cohabiting with. I understand this was not the hotels fault
Title: Sister hotel on Westminster Bridge is much better

Positive_reviews: Nothing

When we got the room the bathroom door was completely broken, with a 4 year boy we needed a bathroom door... so they gave us another room next day which wasn't an executive room as we paid, different category. Was it clean? NO! Rubbish behind the sofa bed, they can check, probably is still there, rubbish in the drawers. They still need to work on that. Nice breakfast, and also the spa area.

Basic things when staying in a hotel. Expected much better standard from a hotel of that expense. Been to a lot of bog standard hotels and never had to  complain about  basic house keeping .
Title: Bad

Positive_reviews:
1)  The room was good with sufficient facilities and accoutrements.
2)  By opting out of housekeeping changing towels every day a free bottle of white or red wine was offered.  The Merlot was really good!
3)  The menu, with plenty of choices, was available for room delivery 24 hours a day. 
4)  Staff were, smart, polite and friendly.
Negative_reviews:
1)  The breakfast order card was not collected, despite being put out before the 02.00 deadline.  
2)  Continental breakfast was fine but the bacon on the English breakfast was inedible, being far, far too cooked. 
3)  The newspaper I ordered did not appear nor was there one waiting at reception.
Title: My stay was okay but I think I will try a different hotel next time I am in the city.

Negative_reviews: House keeping came to clean only once throughout  our 6 nights and when they did, they did a shabby and rush job. Aside that accommodation and location was fantastic
Title: Pleasant

Room_info: Deluxe King Room with River View
Positive_reviews:
The staff were very friendly and welcoming. 
The hotel had a bottle of Prosecco for us in the room as we were celebrating my husbands 40th birthday.
The views were very good too.
Negative_reviews:
The breakfast was manic! It was very busy but the as food just didn’t seem to be set up for the sheer amount of people that were there. There wasn’t room to move around each other, so lots of pushing and shoving for food! The food was quite cold as well, so could have done with being replenished more often.
The air con in the room wasn’t working, which we were told on check out! So the room was so hot.
The bed linen was also very noisy, so we didn’t get much sleep.
I paid just under £200 for the night, which in comparison to other hotels in London around the same price, was expensive for what we got.
The photos online gave a very different view of what the hotel was actually like & unfortunately I won’t be staying here again.
Title: Great staff, but expensive for what we got - few issues with the room and breakfast was not good..

Negative_reviews: The bathroom was not clean, especially shower. The breakfast was the worse, first we had to wait to get in the breakfast area and then the food was awful, not much choice either. Don`t recommend this hotel at all.

Title: Fair

From 5 nights spent, we only could sleep 2, the other nights there was terrible guests at our floor having fights. Reception did not andwer the phone to ask for security guys. 
Our fire alarm started going with no reason, automated lighting system did not work properly, one lightbulb was broken, left it on the table, there it was the whole 5 days. Cleaning team left us half empty water bottle ( not ours) on the floor, wet pillowcase on the bed (not ours either), took bathroom floormat and did not put it back, did not leave new waterbottle until on our last day. Tables were so dusty.
Breakfast was kind of fight for survival, had to wait a long queu, there were not enough dishes for everything, only 2 coffeemachines etc.
Overall disappointment for Radisson quality.

Negative_reviews: Service in the Chino Restaurant was appalling, had to wait ages to be served, wait ages for our drinks to arrive, wait ages before anybody took our food order, the food arrived 15 minutes apart instead of being served together, when my meal eventually arrived I asked for another drink, the waiter said no problem and then forgot all about it, I asked again and then my daughter requested another drink also, my drink was served straight away my daughters drink took another 15 minutes, the waiters and waitresses were all very friendly and polite but service was terrible.
Title: Okay

Negative_reviews: I chose the hotel because it’s highly rated; however, I’m not satisfied on so many levels, even though I selected an executive suite 1. Rooms are not clean (I had to ask them to change the bed’s sheets more than 3 times, and they ignored me. 2. I ordered room service, tea mugs were not clean either; and there were lipstick stains. 3. Room service takes forever; I ordered bathroom slippers and complimentary water and it literally took them an hour and a half. I had to call them so many times. 4. The fire alarm went on, and nobody called us or checked on the safety of their guests. 5. Room service and front desk take forever to answer. To be honest, I’m not gonna stay in this hotel again.
Title: I chose the hotel because it’s highly rated; however, I’m not satisfied on so many levels, even though I selected an exe

Positive_reviews: Nice size room, some staffs was friendly but 1st staff when arrive wasn't very helpful or cheerful. Did not explained about the mini bar.
Negative_reviews:
Bit dusting on the floor and sideboard. Not polish properly. No slippers available to use. View outside just roof.  Can hear the pipe rattle in the bathroom. 
Also very confusing and very crowded when we had our breakfast. As it was not clear if we need to collect foods ourselves or the waiter bring it to us.
Title: Pleasant

Positive_reviews:
Modern feel
Good choice of drinks at the bar
Bar staff very good! Friendly and attentive!
Negative_reviews:
-Check in/desk staff very rude and unfriendly, particularly the woman that served me. 
-Had to wait 2.5 hours for our room with no indication of how long we would be waiting, despite arriving after our check in time! 
-Concierge staff were very unprofessional!
-tv remote did not work very well, and was made out to be a liar!  We arrived to the tv playing a very annoying looped display to annoying music, also on a loop, we couldn’t turn it off.... a rude technician turned up when he wasn’t supposed to and made my girlfriend feel very uncomfortable and stupid! 
- the room had very little if not no natural light, the window was about 400mm high from the floor at the bottom of a low skeiling, you literally had to crawl on your hands and knees to look out of it! 
- I don’t feel the room was satisfactory, given that I had paid for an executive room and ‘requested’ a veiw Of some sort. 
Overall I’m very disappointed with my stay!
Title: Just about ok

Positive_reviews: The Christmas set reception was beautiful. The hotel upon arrival was really a lovely welcoming. Very nice
Negative_reviews: The communication from the receptionist, didn’t feel she gave us any help or information
Title: Was pleasant but did expect better

Positive_reviews: I liked all of the touch in the hotel. Like star lights in the lift and the bathroom, encouraged me to relax which I needed after a long week.
Negative_reviews: I did not like the I found a empty red bull can in my room on arrival. Made me believe that the room was not cleaned properly.
Title: Pleasant

Positive_reviews: The hotel was quite good and the room was spacious as expected with a great view across the river.
Negative_reviews:
The heating in our room didn't work properly. We reported the fault after the first night but nothing was done.
Reported again the next day and were then moved to another room so for the three nights we stayed we spent two without much in the way of heating. Not really good enough!
Title: Disappointing!

Room_info: Studio Double Room with Sofa Bed

Negative_reviews: Hotel is cold, badly decorated and not inviting. Lots of sharp edges to furniture no good for children. Bathroom door didn’t shut properly, shower door didn’t shut properly. Water damage to hinges on shower.
Title: Very over priced but good location

Positive_reviews: It was clean, comfortable and in a good location.
Negative_reviews: I think the hotel is too concerned with being cool and on trend and doesn’t focus enough on being friendly and helpful. I also overheard how badly some of the restaurant staff were talked to by their management. This hotel might be fine for a business trip but if you’re looking for warm friendly place to stay for a holiday this is not the place to go!
Title: Pleasant

Positive_reviews: Facilities and staff were extremely nice but food gave my other half food poisoning
Negative_reviews: The food could be a little better. By not giving people food poisoning
Title: Alotttt of pukeeee.

Positive_reviews: Location and overall hotel facilities
Negative_reviews: The room was not clean bed not clean found false eyelashes in the bed tissues all under the bed ! Very disappointed. When I told check out all she offered was a points card ? Shocking
Title: Due to the cleanliness of the room, disappointing

Positive_reviews: Swimming pool
Negative_reviews: Room was not ready at 2.30pm when we checked in. Went to bar as directed for complimentary drink. Came back 2 hours later to be told room still not ready. Not happy as going out at 17.15 pm.  Got quite cross . Room suddenly became ready.  Excuse was housekeeping not working well. No excuse to be 2.30 hours late for check in. Sorry will not be stopping again. Too stressful.

Instead, for the next three days we didn’t have our towels changed, the room wasn’t cleaned, trash wasn’t taken out and we had to ask for extra toiletries.

Title: Pleasant

Room_info: Deluxe King Room with River View
Positive_reviews: The view. The bed was comfy too.
Negative_reviews:
Some of the staff didn't act professional, they were acting too familiar, especially during breakfast. Maybe this is a London thing? 
The room also wasn't ready when I wanted to check in, which was 2,5h after the mentioned check in time. So I had to wait for it.
The room also wasn't really clean. Not dirty per se, but for that amount of money I expect more from a hotel. There was dust on the ceiling, lime in the shower and shower glass, tv furniture was actually broken.
And the windows felt old (or cheap?), they didn't keep any street noise out. Will not go there again.
Title: Pleasant

Negative_reviews: Breakfast was awful; in particular the sampled eggs were horrible and not what would be expected from a trip to the UK. The Breakfast room is far too small for all guests. Having to eat on seating designed for a night cup with children was not appropriate.

Positive_reviews: The business center, the gym and swimming pool.

I did not like the room to be unattended for cleaning by room service, as it takes  so long to  clean the room, usually after 2 pm, and I don't know if this is the scheduled service time, even though we were up much earlier.
I did not like the breakfast as it was of limited choices and slow service.
I did not like the fact that hotel has no good area to sit in the lobby for those who do not want to drink or eat in the bar or stay in the room.
Title: Good hotel in general for good value with great location, but breakfast choice need to be extended.

Positive_reviews: Not much
Negative_reviews: Couldn’t sleep because the fancy light control unit would not turn off so the room was full of bright blue light. No vegan food and a condescending room service person. Wires everywhere.
Title: Fair

Positive_reviews: Room good standard  poor location
Negative_reviews: Very poor room at back of hotel    too much noise   not much sleep
Title: Fair

Positive_reviews: The bed was very comfortable and a great central location
Negative_reviews: On first arriving, the kettle in our room ( didn’t realise it was faulty) set off the fire alarm,as it did not switch itself off.  The staff that attended were very rude and practically accused us of smoking!  The next day we were awoken at 6am due to another fire alarm.  We had to leave the buildings and it was not well handled.  Turned out that steam from the sauna was the problem. We did not get a proper apology.
Title: Disappointing  - some staff attitudes to customers need urgent review

Positive_reviews: Room was modern and clean
Negative_reviews:
The hotel was very modern, but a little far from tube for walking but close enough to not require a taxi.
After first night, we asked for our coffee and sugar etc to be replenished. Main reason was only decaf sachets were left in tray. When we returned for that night, no sugar and they had replenished our coffee with 6 pods for a coffee machine which we didn't have in our room. Complained again and  next day sure enough, we got sugar, double quantity of decaf sachets and 8 pods, but still no regular coffee.
At over £160 per night for 3 nights, we also asked if we were actually in the Superior room paid for as we were on 1st floor along from both pool one way and bar the other and got a mmmm yes!! I wonder mmmm!!!!
Title: What is regular coffee

Positive_reviews: Cool features in room, automatic blind and control next to bed.
Negative_reviews: Under sheet and bed head had fluid stains all over them, and TV didn’t work on arrival (addressed when I raised the issue). Shower also could have been cleaner. Requested toiletry products from reception after arrival and they never turned up. Charges 50 pound per night deposit, despite booking.com page saying it is 50 pound for the stay. Breakfast was added to our invoice, despite us rejecting the offer at check in. We raised this issue on our second day and we were told it would be sorted, but it was still on our account at checkout. Went up to the bar last night for a drink on our last night but weren’t even acknowledged. I had to approach bar staff for menu and after 15 minutes of not being served we walked out. Then tried to get buffalo wings from room service and they were sold out despite being on late night menu.

When we returned at 8pm with our tired children and ready for bed we were told there was an issue with our room and it wasn’t ready despite us arriving 9 hours prior!! When we got to the room it was not the room that we booked. We had a double and a single fold out bed, when we had booked a double and a double fold out bed. Poor experience

Positive_reviews: location
